name: Chimay Cinq Cents
description: Named Cinq Cents in 75 cl (25.4 fl.oz.) bottles, this beer, with its typical golden color, slightly hazy appearance and fine head, is especially characterized by its aroma which results from an agreeable combination of fresh hops and yeast.It was first brewed by the monks of Chimay at Scourmont Abbey in 1966.

name: Carakale Black Camel Spider
description: Imperial Porter brewed with Jordanian Dates and Bedouin coffee roasted with cardamom. "In the early days of Carakale, there was so much work to be done that I was living in the brewery - just me and two curious Camel Spiders! Each night before bed, I would shout a warning to my unwanted roommates, 'Shebeth!' (Arabic for camel spider) 'I'm not afraid!' Camel Spiders are the size of a grown man's palm, they run 30mph, and possess two sets of fangs. First set to bite and the second to pull you in! With time and several experimental Stouts and Ales to fuel my bravery, I faced down my fears and conquered obstacles to make Carakale a reality. Shebeth... this one's for you!"

reviews.author: Thomas
reviews.body: As an almost exclusive stout drinker I enjoyed this porter. The date and cardamom flavors pop well and blend with the coffee. On top of that it's got a good bottle design.

name: Breaking Bad Schraderbräu

reviews.author: Eduardo P.
reviews.body: delicious, tasty, smooth. will keep buying

reviews.author: Anonymous .
reviews.body: Purchased another round. Amazing beer, fast shipping and safely packaged. Thanks Craftshack!

reviews.author: Frank C.
reviews.body: They thought it was really cool and enjoyed the taste!

reviews.author: Anonymous B.
reviews.body: One of my new favorite beers. Very smooth and refreshing. I only drink regular American light beers so I wasn't sure if I would like this buts it's awesome. Will be buying again.

reviews.author: William B.
reviews.body: I was pleasantly surprised from the moment I removed the cap. I'm glad I ordered six of them, and I might have to order some more.

name: Belching Beaver Peanut Butter Milk Stout
description: Our Peanut Butter Milk Stout is simply irresistible. It’s like dark chocolate Reese’s in a glass! Rolled oats and Lactose add to the creamy body of this beer while heavenly aromas of roasted buttery peanuts and chocolate greet you with every sip. Try this out with a scoop of vanilla ice cream for a real treat!

reviews.author: Kelly G.
reviews.body: this beer is phenomenal!! can’t wait to try more brews from Belching ******.. cheers!

reviews.author: Carmela G.
reviews.body: This was my first peanut butter Stout and let me tell you it was AMAZING!!! Served it with a scoop of French vanilla ice cream and dived in!! Yumm

reviews.author: Mary B.
reviews.body: This beer is awesome, I wish I could find it in stores in Ohio.

reviews.author: Diane O.
reviews.body: I sent this to my nephew who was really bummed about turning 40 in isolation. He lives in Wisconsin and this beer is not available in stores where he lives. He has tried other Peanut Butter Stouts, but said this one blew them out of the water. He was very excited to receive them and thanked us multiple times for sending them. Thanks for making that single guy's Pandemic Isolation more epic!

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.body: Pours to a jet black color with a thick rocky tan head and a luscious chocolate and peanut butter nose. Taking a sip, the beer is full bodied with smooth milk chocolate and creamy peanut butter notes. The peanut butter is bold and really tastes like peanut butter. In many of these beers I get roasted nuts or just a generic nuttiness, but the smooth creaminess of peanut butter is hard to pull off. This beer does it, and then some.

name: Bellwoods Barn Owl (No. 18) Wild Ale
description: As years passed and our oak aged beer became more robust, we discovered many unique, interesting, single barrels deserving of a special release. Barn Owl was created as a response to these lone wolves, and has grown into a diverse, ongoing series that reflects the growing diversity of our barrel program. The name is a nod to the wise and exacting animal that keeps watch over the farmhouse (er..industrial warehouse), and the one-off creations are released sporadically throughout the year, just as soon as we deem the barrels ripe for the picking.Inspired by the 2017 vintage of Motley Cru -- Barn Owl No. 18 began as a blend of a brett inoculated pale ale from one of our new foeders and a sour golden ale from one of our more sour-forward OG foeders before conditioning on passionfruit purée. The result is highly drinkable with huge tropical fruit flavours and aromas, notes of preserved lemon, pineapple and a hint of earthy funk.

name: Bellwoods Barn Owl (No. 17) Wild Ale
description: As years passed and our oak aged beer became more robust, we discovered many unique, interesting, single barrels deserving of a special release. Barn Owl was created as a response to these lone wolves, and has grown into a diverse, ongoing series that reflects the growing diversity of our barrel program. The name is a nod to the wise and exacting animal that keeps watch over the farmhouse (er..industrial warehouse), and the one-off creations are released sporadically throughout the year, just as soon as we deem the barrels ripe for the picking.Barn Owl No. 17 began as a blend of a sour golden ale and a bretty pale ale before being locked away in wine puncheons for extended barrel-aging. The blend was dry-hopped prior to barrel-aging to create a stable, well-rounded hop character -- and then dry-hopped after emerging from the barrel creating a lovely balance between a dank dry-hop, brett funk and a pleasant acidity. Flavours and aromas of pineapple, peach skin and plum.

name: 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze
description: Blend of 1, 2, and 3 year old lambics.A true Geuze - a blend of 1, 2, and 3 year-old lambic, unfiltered and unpasteurized, and aged in the bottle for at least a year after blending. Refermentation in the bottle gives this Geuze its famous champagne-like spritziness. The lambic that goes into it is brewed only with 60% barley malt, 40% unmalted wheat, aged hops, and water, spontaneously fermented by wild yeasts, and matured in oak casks.

reviews.author: Gregory
reviews.body: A really good lambic with a really interesting flavor profile and wonderful bouquet. Would highly recommend trying. Traditional sour and I love it!

reviews.author: Greg
reviews.body: This is an exceptional lambic style beer and worth trying if you have never had this beer before (or any other beers from 3 Fonteinen). It has a wonderful bouquet and a complex flavor profile. It is quite sour and overall delightful!

reviews.author: Dan V.
reviews.body: One of if not my favorite oude geuze

reviews.author: Anthony
reviews.body: Glad I was able to get my hands on this. I've needed a break from all the juice bombs and what better way than to drink a classic gueuze.

reviews.author: Brian J.
reviews.body: This geuze is as good as Cantillon or Tilquin. It’s nice to have a place to order from and not pay the astronomical shipping price from Belgium

name: Belching Beaver Barrel-Aged Viva La Beaver Imperial Stout
description: Immense chocolate and cinnamon flavors integrate with the complex flavors harnessed from 14 months of aging in Rye Whiskey barrels, to create an amazingly decadent barrel-aged stout for your enjoyment.

reviews.author: Loren
reviews.body: This beer went down a little to easily

reviews.author: Eric L.
reviews.body: Good peanut butter flavor and a light barrel.

reviews.author: Michael
reviews.body: Mexican hot chocolate spiked with some rye. Delicious.

name: New Holland Dragon's Milk Reserve: Rum Barrel-Aged Stout with Chocolate, Hazelnut, & Toasted Coconut
description: The first Reserve release of 2020 was aged for 3 months in rum barrels imported from Jamaica and finished on over 2,500 pounds of coconut, 1,000 pounds of toasted hazelnut, and 200 pounds of chocolate. The use of authentic ingredients enhances the flavors imparted by the barrel, including notes of rich molasses and sweet vanilla, without overpowering this delicious brew.

reviews.author: Kevin W.
reviews.body: Shipping is always speedy (and I live on the opposite end of the country) product is always carefully packaged, and customer service is very responsive. I love ordering from Craftshack and will continue to!

name: Lost Coast Peanut Butter Chocolate Milk Stout

reviews.author: Ben
reviews.body: Great flavor with a good mix of chocolate and peanut butter! Not heavy at all...good everyday drinker. Would definitely order more!

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.body: Is was very smooth Taste of peanut butter & chocolate.

reviews.author: Rick K.
reviews.body: It was very good nice flavor.

reviews.author: Corey O.
reviews.body: Love this Beer!

reviews.author: frank t.
reviews.body: Thin but fits the label. The aroma wafts at you from feet away! Great chocolate PB balance.

name: Beachwood Hayabusa
description: Hayabusa is an ultra-crisp and refreshing Japanese-style lager made with American barley, Canadian pilsner, toasted flaked rice and German Hallertau Mittelfruh.

name: Lost Coast Great White
description: Our version of the Belgian style, this unfiltered wheat beer has a translucent golden color. Topped with a hint of citrus, coriander and a secret blend of herbs.

reviews.author: Alejandra P.
reviews.body: Easy drink, had this with hot wings! Great compliment!

reviews.author: Pete
reviews.body: Great for sippin’ while grilling some burgers. Good stuff.

reviews.author: Jason
reviews.body: Easy to drink. Nice taste

name: Beachwood Amalgamator IPA
description: Amalgamator is a "West Coast" IPA that's bursting with unique aromas and flavors. A light base of American 2-row malt makes way for the hops to take the stage. Amalgamator is hopped in the kettle with Amarillo, Warrior, Columbus, and Mosaic, a brand new American variety. The dry hop is a massive charge of Mosaic that lays down an amalgam of passion fruit, dank resin, and citrus aromas. 99+ IBUs.

reviews.author: Brian
reviews.body: Clearest and tastiest IPA I've ever had. 10/10

reviews.author: Paul
reviews.body: The only IPA I’ve ever had that I think beats stone head to head!

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.body: Was just too piney for me

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.body: It was ok ,prefer more juicy though

reviews.author: Brendan
reviews.body: Excellent West Coast style! Worth the purchase!!

name: Second Chance Clever Hoppy Name
description: Light, dry malt. Big juicy dry hop flavors from Mosaic & Citra. Touch of Tangerine Peel.

name: Avery Pacer IPA
description: A modern, hop forward, full-flavored Hazy IPA at only 100 calories and 3.5 carbs.

name: Modern Times Orderville Mosaic IPA

reviews.author: CHRISTINE W.
reviews.body: Outrageously good - one of the best beers I have ever had. Need to get more in stock soon.

reviews.author: BD
reviews.body:
2 finger white head cresting over the rim of the glass. Outstanding retention, still sitting at 1 finger 5 minutes after the initial pour. Thick lacing. Opaque orange IPA. Good looking Hazy beer.
Blueberry and oranges on the fruit side of the hop. Pine and a hint of dank on the green side of the hop.
Berry and melon are prominent with some citrus (orange/tangerine/grapefruit) and tropical (pineapple) flavors in supporting roles. Bready malt is apparent in the finish...nice balance.
Full body, medium carbonation. Soft and creamy mouthfeel. Low bitterness. Fruit filled medium length finish.
Very good. 2 for 2 on Modern Times beers for me and my palate...good stuff.

reviews.author: Christen
reviews.body: A nice juicy body with mouth watering hops - no amazing flavors but still good.

reviews.author: James M.
reviews.body: Perfect hop fest!

reviews.author: James M.
reviews.body: At the top of the heap in the craft beer double IPA category!

name: Modern Times Star Cloud IPA
description: Hazy IPA with Citra, Cashmere, Motueka, and Centennial hops

name: Modern Times Black House Coffee Ale

reviews.author: Bill
reviews.body: I had to get my hands on this after visiting the brewery and being gifted some Black House coffee. Not disappointed! It's very smooth, dark, and slightly rich, exactly like their coffee. It's a great compliment.

reviews.author: Joseph
reviews.body: they don't make a bad beer PERIOD! Not really a fan of coffee ales or stouts and I enjoyed this.

reviews.author: Shane
reviews.body: Follows the nose, big coffee notes with some chocolate and malt sweetness. Medium body, however a little watery and weak for a stout. Lacks depth. Very nice.

reviews.author: Vince Y.
reviews.body: Could be better

reviews.author: Jon H.
reviews.body: Great flavor, smooth, better at the brewery of course!

name: Modern Times Fortunate Islands Pale Ale

reviews.author: Mark B.
reviews.body: This has some nice tropical notes to it. Flavors of mango and tangerine come through. Not overly hoppy. Good summer brew.

reviews.author: Valeria
reviews.body: This was the very first Modern Times I'd ever tried, and I liked it a lot. If they say is not the best, I'm excited to try all the others!

reviews.author: Kevin
reviews.body: I’ve had a few other Modern Times beer and this is my least favorite. Pretty underwhelming IPA.

reviews.author: justin
reviews.body: Good but not their best

name: Mikkeller Staff Magician
description: New England Style Pale Ale hopped with Mosaic, Citra and Nugget.

reviews.author: Seyed
reviews.body: Always impressed with their beers. Will buy this again!

reviews.author: Seyed
reviews.body: Easy to drink, great overall taste

reviews.author: Christopher
reviews.body: just another solid beer from Mikkeller, great balance makes this an easy drinker

reviews.author: Brendan
reviews.body: Definitely worth the dollars! Easy to drink at 5% and totally worth sharing with friends! Heaven in a glass!

reviews.author: Pierre M.
reviews.body: Very nice one, sour and fruity at the same time, worth it!

name: Mikkeller San Diego Windy Hill
description: New England Style Hazy India Pale Ale

reviews.author: Phillip T.
reviews.body: Pours from the can a nice hazy golden color with a solid foamy head. Aroma from my glass had a tropical citrus smell with slight hoppy hints to it. Taste mimicked the aromas I could smell. Fresh tropical fruits with citrus fruits following at the end. Medium bodied mouthfeel. Overall, if this was readily available by me, it would be in the running for my go-to IPA.

reviews.author: Kenneth w.
reviews.body: Nice beer. Would like to enjoy it again...

reviews.author: Robert Y.
reviews.body: Would definitely recommend this one

reviews.author: Andrew R.
reviews.body: A little juicy a little bitter.

reviews.author: Brendan
reviews.body: Fresh, delicous and worth the 2nd buy. Might be doing a 3rd buy ;-)

name: Modern Times Blazing World IPA

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.body: Modern Times Blazing World pours to a slightly cloudy orange amber color with a light fluffy head and “dank” leafy herbal notes. Thick Brussels lace forms on the sides of my glass and follows the beer to the bottom of the glass.Taking a sip, the beer is medium in maltiness (I’d like more), there are “dank” herbal leafy notes mixed with tropical mango and citrus fruits, and I like the combination. As it warms, more of both emerge. Nice balance between dank and tropical!

reviews.author: BD
reviews.body:
1" slightly off-white head on a golden-amber, clean, and mostly clear IPA. Good retention on the dense, creamy head with the beginnings of fresh lacing apparent early.
White grape, pine, kiwi...unique hop profile over a light caramel/bready malt base. 
Tangy Nelson hops are the show here. Grape (mild Sauvignon Banc character) and berries. Zingy, zesty flavors.
Medium in body and carbonation. Balanced finish with a touch of malt sweetness and then lingering mild bitterness that dries out the beer in the end.
Very good, unique hop profile and high drinkability.

reviews.author: Joseph
reviews.body: Modern Times knocked it out of the park, a new go to. Definitely one of the better dank ipas out there.

reviews.author: Sari J.
reviews.body: One of the best red IPAs I’ve ever had. I crave this at the end of the day...it’s my surefire go-to. This is what I compare other red IPAs to. Can’t wait to visit their brewery in San Diego.

reviews.author: Paul
reviews.body: Not a super big Amber fan, this one was done right. Perfect balance of malts to bitterness.

name: Coronado Tropical Darkroom IPA
description: Kettle sour IPA brewed and dry hopped with fruit forward sabro and mosaic hops

name: Foreign Objects Dream of Perfect Beauty Hazy IPA
description: Drink me deeply and you will experience the deluge of my perfected mystickal expansion in the heaven of our theta waves! Nelson Sauvin and Simcoe hops commingle and inside their ivory box resides the intense aromas of deep grape must, peach and citrus pulp, gooseberry, and resinous earth waiting to lead you through the gates of horn and ivory to the heaven underneath!

name: Coronado Shaka Berry Pastry Stout
description: Shakka Berry blends tart boysenberries and blackberries with rich cocoa and vanilla bean for waves of flavor in this decadent pastry stout. Hang loose and enjoy the ride!

reviews.author: Thomas H.
reviews.body: This one was very tasty with a nice berry flavor

reviews.author: Case
reviews.body: Very sweet - berry flavor gives it some complexity, otherwise - 16 oz is tough to finish in one sitting

reviews.author: Brendan A.
reviews.body: Sorry for the dad pun, but this one is top notch! Great berry taste without being too sweet combined with the deep flavors of a stout!

name: Foreign Objects Fetish Culture: Blueberry Lemon Meringue
description: New-American heavily hopped & brewed w/ oats, lactose, blueberry purée, vanilla beans & lemon zest 7.5%

name: Coronado Orange Avenue Wit
description: Our spiced California style Wit is both refreshing and complex. Brewed with wheat, coriander, California orange peel and local orange blossom honey. From the first sip to the last you’ll find subtle flavors of bread, spice, citrus and a thirst quenching orange honey finish.

reviews.author: Victoria
reviews.body: Happy to get my boyfriend a beer that is otherwise hard to get

name: Chapman Crafted Kool Kid Hops DIPA
description: Double IPA with Citra, Mosaic & Galaxy hops.

name: Burgeon Treevana IPA
description: West Coast IPA hopped with Mosaic & Amarillo

reviews.author: Greg E.
reviews.body: Really nice. Good bitterness without being overpowering. Nice herbal touch at the end.

reviews.author: Valeria
reviews.body: Not the best IPA. It has a malty aftertaste.

reviews.author: Brendan
reviews.body: Good IPA that is easy to drink & not too pricey! Fresh AF too! Less than a month old!

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.body: A modern San Diego staple, the Burgeon Treevana IPA has all the touchstones of the WCIPA but less bitterness than its predecessors with a light body, hoppy flavor, and dry finish. Mosaic and Amarillo collide to create citrus and tropical flavors. You could drink this all day!

reviews.author: Joseph
reviews.body: I enjoyed the taste but kind of sweet aftertaste

name: Burgeon Carlsbad Crush
description: West Coast Pale Ale brewed solely with Mosaic and Mosaic Cryo

name: Brouwerij West Popfuji Pilsner
description: Our take on the historic Kellerbier, Popfuji Unfiltered Pilsner delivers a delicate malt sweetness combined with a subtle fruit and spice character from the use of German Noble Hops. Unlike the typical Pilsner, however, Popfuji's uniqueness is in it's smooth, creamy texture, making it perfect for any occasion.

name: Burgeon Clever Kiwi
description: Keller Pils dry-hopped delicately with Nelson and lagered to crisp perfection. 2019 Los Angeles International Beer Competition Gold Medal.

name: Brouwerij West Picnic Lightning IPA
description: Mecca Grade Estate Malt, Raw Wheat, and Rolled Oats. Heavily hopped with Chinook, Simcoe, and Citra.

reviews.author: totallybrewedco
reviews.body: not as good as their other hazy ipas but its still good and easy drinking.

reviews.author: Patrick
reviews.body: This is a must buy when it's in stock. Super blessed to be able to try this one. One of my favorite canned hazy ipas I have ever had, and I am no novice beer drinker!!!

reviews.author: Frank
reviews.body: Buy this beer and every Brouwerij beer you can. Haven’t had a bad one and can’t get enough of them.

reviews.author: Frank
reviews.body: BROUWERIJ WEST is a superb brewery. Under-looked to its on fault, due to many other incredible breweries in the area. Picnic Lighting is one of the top offerings from Brouwerij West. Citrus forward, very fruity and has a hazy thick appearance with a glittery head. Love this one. Grab it from Craftshack when it is in stock and fresh.

name: Burgeon Juice Press
description: Hazy IPA loaded with Galaxy, Vic Secret, Citra and Simcoe hops creating the perfect combination of tropical fruity flavors and aromas!

reviews.author: Sean F.
reviews.body: Smooth and juicy ipa

reviews.author: Franco M.
reviews.body: Very enjoyable beer, not too hoppy.

reviews.author: Patrick
reviews.body: Great hazy IPA very flavorful worth trying

reviews.author: Brian
reviews.body: Anything with Vic Secret is a must try

name: Bottle Logic 714 Blonde
description: Crisp and easy drinking – backed by a sweet malt finish.

reviews.author: Khalil R.
reviews.body: just a crisp blonde ale

reviews.author: Anthony
reviews.body: Nothing special here, simple flavor profile.

name: Brouwerij West Dog Ate My Homework
description: A fresh, decidedly fruit-forward saison brewed with lots of Washington state blackberry juice. This beer is deep, deep red in color, but rather than being sweet like many fruit beers, it is dry, tart, and refreshing.

reviews.author: Anthony V.
reviews.body: Tasty very tasty indeed

name: Blaker Safety Meeting IPA
description: Relaxing & mellow or treacherous & trippy

name: Black Project Tombstone Sour
description: Double Dry Hopped Sour Ale With Grapefruit

name: Black Project Archer Sour
description: Peach Pie Sour Wheat. Juiced peach, cinnamon, and vanilla swirl together in this 100% sour wheat base beer. Lightly tart, with driving vanilla, Archer is the perfect beer for a cold afternoon

name: Black Plague Hazy Scandal
Black Plague Tony Hawps IPA
description: This collaboration with BIRDHOUSE & Tony Hawk manifested into an incredibly smooth beer, full of juicy hop flavors and low bitterness. Brewed with Simcoe and Amarillo hops for an earthy pine foundation balanced with notes of tropical orange citrus and hints of fresh floral from the Citra and Centennial used in the dry-hop to enhance the outstanding aroma.

reviews.author: Jacob S.
reviews.body: It was pretty good for an ipa. Not too heavy, not too bitter. This would be perfect in the summer on a beach in San Diego.

reviews.author: Chet
reviews.body: A great looking beer - Bright golden pour with a frothy head. Nice aroma with pine resin, some floral notes, oranges, and faint malt. Taste was their for the most part. Very little bitterness but not to much. It was there up front with the citrus notes but then faded quickly. IBUs are on point.

reviews.author: Bryan Y.
reviews.body: This is my favorite beer! Crispy, hoppy, fresh and great amount of DANK!

reviews.author: Bryan Y.
reviews.body: This is a great beer! I would like to get more soon!

reviews.author: Daniel B.
reviews.body: This brew is nice and smooth and enjoyable. Each sip was great and you will not be disappointed.

name: Bootlegger's Far Out Fog
description: Far Out tweaked to be hazier.

name: Bissell Brothers The Substance
description: Our flagship; a brightly dank ale that threads many needles.HOPS: Falconer's Flight, Centennial, Apollo, Eureka, ChinookMALTS: 2-Row, Maine 2-Row, Maine Flaked Wheat, Flaked Oats, Caramel 20

name: Bissell Brothers Lux Pale Ale
description: Our all-Mosaic hopped Pale Ale, brewed with Rye. A tropical escape to a sunnier state of mind.Paul Upham's favorite beer

name: Big Sky Moose Drool Brown Ale
description: It's chocolate brown in color with a creamy texture. A malty beer with just enough hop presence to keep it from being too sweet. The aroma mostly comes from the malt with a hint of spice added by the hops. Moose Drool is brewed with pale, caramel, chocolate, and whole black malts; and Kent Goldings, Liberty, and Willamette hops. It has an original gravity of 13 degrees Plato, and is 4.2% alcohol by weight, 5.3% by volume.

reviews.author: Melissa J.
reviews.body: Beer is great and just as he remembers it from our travels up north. Buying it online was easy but beware the stipulation that someone has to be there to sign for it on delivery. We were able to intercept and have delivered to a fed ex station close by but it was not clear in the instructions

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.body: It was a classic American Brown a Ale. Had not had it 15 years. Glad you guys had it.

reviews.author: Arriana S.
reviews.body: Moose Drool by Big Sky Brewing stopped distributing to TX. My husbands favourite beer in the world. Thankfully Craft Shack is here to help! Their customer service replied to me with questions within 12 hours and my package arrived safely. He was very happy and I’m glad Craftshack offers their services because it is very difficult (so far that I’ve tried, and looked up) to ship alcohol to TX. Thank you!

name: Bell's Two Hearted Ale
description: Brewed with 100% Centennial hops from the Pacific Northwest and named after the Two Hearted River in Michigan’s Upper Peninsula, this IPA is bursting with hop aromas ranging from pine to grapefruit from massive hop additions in both the kettle and the fermenter.

reviews.author: Michael H.
reviews.body: Refresing wit no after taste Right alcohol concentration.

reviews.author: Victor L.
reviews.body: This is something you will always find in my beer cellar.Its the most balanced IPA Ive ever tasted, balanced between malty and hoppy flavors. Its a beer to drink all day long.

reviews.author: Guy M.
reviews.body: One sip, and you will know why. Perfectly balanced. An excellent hop finish that isn’t overpowering. Just right.

reviews.author: Gi N.
reviews.body: Very good beer. Good representative of the NE beers.

reviews.author: Paul S.
reviews.body: Pours a perfect summer sunset and smells of citrus wonder. The taste has just enough hop forwardness to please. Silky mouth finish with perfect carbonation. Overall this one is the benchmark for all IPAs to be measured by. Buy plenty and share with ll of your friends.

name: Belching Beaver Viva La Beaver Mexican Chocolate Peanut Butter Stout
description: Formally named Viva La Beaver, and prior, Living La Beaver Loca (Tom was voted down on that one), we changed the name to highlight the key flavors of this award-winning beer. With notes of creamy peanut butter, cinnamon and coffee, this decadent milk stout is the perfect dessert beer to finish off your meal. Currently our highest rated beer, receiving numerous Gold and Silver medals. Sink your teeth into this liquid chocolate treat.

reviews.author: Tracy D.
reviews.body: One of our favorites. The flavors are detectable without being overwhelming, and it’s not too bitter.

reviews.author: Big B.
reviews.body: This was a decadent journey filled with sunshine, Stout and peanut butter cups. Thoroughly enjoyable and satisfying as a pancake breakfast!

reviews.author: John Z.
reviews.body: A balanced peanut butter milk chocolate stout with a hint of cinnamon. I thought the cinnamon took away from the over taste. Nice and creamy as well.

reviews.author: Michelle
reviews.body: After finding Belching Beavers Peanut Butter Stout i see they had a mexican chocolate stout.... WOW! What an amazing beer! Pop open the bottle and the scent is crazy!! Chocolate... Cinnamon.... I mean what a delicious stout! If my lil abuelita was here she would've loved this stuff!

reviews.author: Alex
reviews.body:
It was good, but just not great. Paired it with some sloppy home cooking, beef tenderloin
etouffee. Matched well, but it was too sweet as a stand alone for my taste buds,

name: Belching Beaver Peanut Butter Milk Stout
description: Our Peanut Butter Milk Stout is simply irresistible. It’s like dark chocolate Reese’s in a glass! Rolled oats and Lactose add to the creamy body of this beer while heavenly aromas of roasted buttery peanuts and chocolate greet you with every sip. Try this out with a scoop of vanilla ice cream for a real treat!

reviews.author: Kelly G.
reviews.body: this beer is phenomenal!! can’t wait to try more brews from Belching ******.. cheers!

reviews.author: Carmela G.
reviews.body: This was my first peanut butter Stout and let me tell you it was AMAZING!!! Served it with a scoop of French vanilla ice cream and dived in!! Yumm

reviews.author: Mary B.
reviews.body: This beer is awesome, I wish I could find it in stores in Ohio.

reviews.author: Diane O.
reviews.body: I sent this to my nephew who was really bummed about turning 40 in isolation. He lives in Wisconsin and this beer is not available in stores where he lives. He has tried other Peanut Butter Stouts, but said this one blew them out of the water. He was very excited to receive them and thanked us multiple times for sending them. Thanks for making that single guy's Pandemic Isolation more epic!

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.body: Pours to a jet black color with a thick rocky tan head and a luscious chocolate and peanut butter nose. Taking a sip, the beer is full bodied with smooth milk chocolate and creamy peanut butter notes. The peanut butter is bold and really tastes like peanut butter. In many of these beers I get roasted nuts or just a generic nuttiness, but the smooth creaminess of peanut butter is hard to pull off. This beer does it, and then some.

name: Belching Beaver Me So Honey Ale
description: This beer is smooth with lingering tastes of honey. It is made right here in Poway from wild flowers and cloves. This is a very drinkable beer for both the novice craft beer drinker to the experienced triple IPA beer guy. We have gone through kegs of this beer already.

name: Belching Beaver Hazers Gonna Haze IPA
description: Hazy IPA showcasing a combination of new age hops that rotate throughout the year.

reviews.author: Brandon W.
reviews.body: Good haze and juicy. Solid IPA.

name: Belching Beaver Here Comes Mango IPA
description: IPA w/ Mango & Pineapple. Originally made for Sublime Alehouse's 4th Anniversary.

reviews.author: Melinda
reviews.body: I’m not a huge fan of ipas but I am a huge fan of belching ******. Very subtle mango flavor but overall good for someone that doesn’t like ipas.

reviews.author: Carolyn G.
reviews.body: Great flavor live this beer mango is

reviews.author: Emily
reviews.body: very smooth citrus flavor. tastes just like mango!

name: Foreign Objects A Brutal Utopian Failure Hazy IPA
description: This fluffy and hazy IPA beautifully hopped with Ekuanot and Mosaic offers you divine aromas of earthly-sweet citrus, dank hop resin, and a melange of juicy stone fruits!

name: Belching Beaver Buenos Tiempos
description: Mexican-style lager.

reviews.author: Sean
reviews.body: Hearty lager, strong grain finish

reviews.author: justin
reviews.body:
Nothing incredibly special but clean flavor profile 

I'd buy again

reviews.author: justin
reviews.body: Clean drinking and taste is about where it should be

name: Firestone Walker 805
description: A light, refreshing blonde ale created for the laid back California lifestyle. Subtle malt sweetness is balanced by a touch of hops creating a versatile beer with a clean finish.

reviews.author: Jennifer B.
reviews.body: Its good for a lighter beer. Not as flavorful as other Firestone Walker beers but still a good beer on a hot summer day.

reviews.author: Donna S.
reviews.body: It is my boyfriend’s birthday tomorrow and I purchased this because it is his favorite. He loves the taste, not too strong and very refreshing.

reviews.author: Joseph C.
reviews.body: Being a Harley nut I discovered this beer from the different west coast riders I follow. I tried it on a business trip to Vegas and fell in love. Being able to get it shipped to NJ was a great thing.

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.body: This is a great, easy drinking Blonde Ale, perfectly suited for a warm sunny day. At about 4.5% ABV, it makes for a good session beer. I will have another!

reviews.author: Michelle D.
reviews.body: Loved this beer and the idea of having it shipped to us on the complete other side of the country.

name: Fat Orange Cat I Don't Like Mondays
description: Galaxy, Mosaic and Simcoe hops.

reviews.author: Richy
reviews.body: Fat orange cat with another great brew

reviews.author: Richy J.
reviews.body: Super good brew

name: Figueroa Mountain Zero to Sexy
description: This Golden Mocha Ale appears mild and meek but behind its gold color is a sexy, complex brew. As this beer approaches your lips, aromas of coffee beans take over your senses, luring you in.  Light, earthy hop profiles make way for rich flavors from the hand roasted coffee and cacao nibs sourced locally in Santa Barbara, California.  Zero to Sexy in just one sip.

name: Evil Twin I Always Look Forward To My Daily Commute On I-95 Triple IPA
description: Nelson, Galaxy, and Citra.

name: Evil Twin I Actually Wish It Had Snowed More This Winter
description: Gose Ale with Watermelon, Salt and Vanilla

name: Evil Twin Even More Jesus Imperial Stout

reviews.author: Angela
reviews.body: Great flavor!

reviews.author: Brendan
reviews.body:
Highly recommended buying this one!
Coffee; cocoa flavors through and through. Totally, recommend it!

You will not regret it!

reviews.author: Paul G.
reviews.body: Great aroma and flavors of coffee top off this pretty full imperial stout.

name: El Segundo Blurred Lines IPA
description: “Hybrid IPA” - Living somewhere between a clear West Coast and North East hazy juice bomb, this beer hopes to find some much needed common ground between the styles. A bit off dry, with fruit forward Mosaic and Citra hops with a touch of pine and lemon from Centennial plus a touch lower carbonation combined with heavy doses of oat and wheat malts leave this beer a bit.. Blurry about it’s identity.

name: Elysian Space Dust IPA
description: Manic IPA series. The hopping is pure starglow energy, with Chinook to bitter and late and dry additions of Citra and Amarillo. OG 16.8°P/1.068 SG

name: Duck Foot The Looker
description: The Duck Foot version of the classic American Blonde Ale. Brewed with a combination of pale and caramelized malts, this beer finishes light and refreshing yet is full in flavor. The use of Cascade hops gives it a light floral citrus aroma to complement the crisp and refreshing taste.

reviews.author: Scott
reviews.body: Easy to drink but lacks body

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.body: Poured it into a pint glass . Very small head. First impression was not very carbonated. Tasted smooth and as I drank it tasted better. Will let you know how the second beer tastes.

name: Duck Foot Kook Slams
description: Collaborating with the crazy curators at Kookslams.We mixed up a super fun and easy-drinking west coast IPA with Mosaic, Amarillo, and Mandarina Bavaria hops and a crisp and clean finish. Check out the big flavors of berries, tangerine and grapefruit.

name: Duck Foot Hop’em Sock’em IPA
description: West coast ipa

reviews.author: David S.
reviews.body: Perfect combination of hoppy flavor and crisp citrus notes.

name: Duck Foot Duckzilla Double White IPA
description: A hybrid of a White Ale and West Coast IPA and super-sized for your drinking pleasure. This Double IPA is brewed with Wheat to give it a pale white color and a slight sweetness in the finish. At its core this is a hop forward beer, bitter and heavily dry-hopped with a combination of Centennial, Cascade, and Simcoe hops. This blend of hops imparts notes of Spice, Citrus, and Pine in the aroma. A deceivingly drinkable beer despite its high alcohol content.

reviews.author: Jon K.
reviews.body: Very smooth for an 8.6 ABV. Good taste, but was hoping for more piney notes.

reviews.author: Bryan R.
reviews.body: Very good double white IPA with a mango taste. Not overpowering and very drinkable. Smooth very and not bitter.

reviews.author: Trenton
reviews.body: Enjoyable

reviews.author: Trent G.
reviews.body: A quality beer from a quality brewery. Remarkable how drinkable this beer and if it was available in my area would definitely make this a regular.

reviews.author: Bryan Y.
reviews.body: A great IPA! HAD ALOT OF FLAVOR AND WHEN DOWN SMOOTH!

name: Duck Foot Drink This Or the Bees Die

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.body: awesome great tasting nice finish. One of the best gluten free beers I have tried.

name: Double Nickel Super Mega Dank 420 Kush Grand Daddy Supreme Hazy IPA
description: Wise beyond his years, Grand Daddy Supreme is everything you loved about last year’s brew, absolutely ripped up and ready to go. Oats, flaked oats, and wheat all join the malt bill to bring you a fluffy, hazed out base for this dank 7% ABV IPA. Couple that with intense notes of tangerines, peaches, apricots brought on by a gargantuan double dry-hopping of Mosaic, Citra, and Azacca and you’re left with the patriarch of the Mega Dank family himself. This hazy hop juice will put your head in the clouds and have you wondering, “Why can’t everyday be 420?” And just like that, it was written; 30 days of 4/20 for the people! And the culture. Dab Time!⁣

name: Double Nickel Nocturnal Creatures V2 Imperial Stout
description: Influenced by one our favorite Italian desserts, this 13% ABV tiramisu-inspired dessert stout stimulates your taste buds with notes of brown sugar, coffee, vanilla, and some chocolate to round it all out. We started this batch out with the same long-boiled base as the OG Nocturnal Creatures but pumped up the sweetness with some brown sugar and a dusting of Dutch chocolate towards the end of the boil. We then conditioned this luscious brew on coffee from our homies and local roasters at Harvest Coffee. Hand-split and scraped Madagascan vanilla beans were combined with the coffee during conditioning resulting in a thicc imperial dessert stout perfect for sipping. ⁣

name: Duck Foot Goofy Regular
description: Goofy Regular Hazy IPA features a goofy amount of Citra, Ekuanot, Amarillo, and Idaho-7 hops. This wave of hops has a lot of juice, but levels itself off with a complex hop aroma of tropical fruit, melon, grapefruit zest, gooseberry, and stone fruit, with notes of pine.

reviews.author: Phillip T.
reviews.body: Nice enjoyable medium mouthfeel. Grapefruit and orange peel on the nose. Has a great balance of different citrus fruits you can taste, with a light bitterness to it that doesn't interfere with the flavors. Super smooth beer you can chill on.

reviews.author: Bert
reviews.body: There isn't anything regular about this beer. The hoppy smooth finish is superb!

reviews.author: Joseph
reviews.body: Becoming one of my favorite breweries this one was delicious!

name: Duck Foot Old Bro Hazy Pale Ale

reviews.author: Shawn P.
reviews.body: If you are into hazy ipas but looking for something with a lower abv without compromising flavor then give this one a try. Really hit the spot on a hot day.

reviews.author: William
reviews.body: Great beer.

name: Dogfish Head American Beauty Hazy Ripple IPA
description: It’s been a long strange trip, and we’re not about to stop now. After six years and four releases of American Beauty, we’re back with an encore … only this time you haven’t heard the melody.Together with the Grateful Dead, we’re proud to introduce our latest collaborative iteration – American Beauty Hazy Ripple IPA.Inspired by the Grateful Dead’s beloved “American Beauty” album, American Beauty Hazy Ripple IPA is an unfiltered India Pale Ale brewed with spelt – an ancient heirloom grain that contributes earthy notes and a natural haze – that’s then dosed with a special yeast variety to accentuate hop aromatics.The result is a psychedelic 7.0% ABV ale that’s bursting with notes of tropical fruit and juicy citrus, while the style callout lovingly references the fan-favorite track “Ripple.”

name: Deschutes Lil' Squeezy Juicy Ale
description: Refreshingly juicy. Effortlessly drinkable. Freshly Squeezed. No fruit was harmed in the making of this beer.

name: Crooked Stave Peachy Sour
description: Peach sour ale brewed with Colorado grown peaches, milk sugar, and Crystal hops

name: Deschutes Fresh Haze IPA
description: A hazy twist on your main squeeze, this juice bomb explodes with notes of orange citrus sweetness and a soft malt body.

reviews.author: Daniel
reviews.body: Can't go wrong with this one from Oregon. Slight citrus notes and easy to drink. A go-to IPA.

reviews.author: Scott
reviews.body: A toasted, malty, hazy ipa with decent hops and a hint of citrus

reviews.author: Rustin D.
reviews.body: A little overly malty, but nice hop flavor. Glad I got to try it but probably wouldn't seek it out again until next year.

name: Crooked Stave Mandarin Dream IPA
description: Brewed with Mandarin Citrus and Vanilla. Double Dry Hopped with Mandarina Bavaria and Citra

name: Mikkeller San Diego Run This Town Pilsner
description: German pilsner with polaris saaz, and hallertau blanc hops

reviews.author: Seyed M.
reviews.body: One of the better pilsners I've bad

reviews.author: Brendan .
reviews.body: Quaffable Pils with a pleasant after taste! I’m not a fan of Pils per se but this is GREAT!

name: Crooked Stave Coffee Baltic Porter
description: Coffee Baltic Porter focuses on the art of coffee roasting, showcasing the uniqueness of this single ingredient. Through conditioning of of our Baltic porter with freshly roasted beans, we strive for a balanced coffee character, adding dark sugar, plum, and cocoa notes to the already robust porter base.

name: Mikkeller San Diego Tiny Scissors IPA
description: Double IPA with Citra and Michigan-grown Chinook

name: Crooked Stave Sour Rosé
description: Wild Ale Fermented in Oak with Raspberries and Blueberries from Lynden, WA!

reviews.author: Randall
reviews.body: It tastes as described but I was tired of it by the end of 12oz

reviews.author: Aaron G.
reviews.body: Nice tartness upfront that fades into a fruity/oaky finish. Very refreshing and crisp. Great summer beer, and my favorite rosé take thus far.

name: Mikkeller San Diego Raspberry Blush
description: Berliner weiss brewed at Mikkeller San Diego with raspberries and Second Craft Ethiopian coffee

reviews.author: Ryan
reviews.body: Not a bad sour. The coffee makes it has a stout flavor in the end.

reviews.author: Phillip T.
reviews.body: Dark roasted Coffee jumps right at you with the aroma followed by light berries in the back, almost tricks you into thinking you are about to drink a stout. Can also smell light berries on the nose. Mouthfeel is very light and smooth. Fresh juicy raspberries and come out first, with that smooth coffee showing up on the finish. Very easy drinking.

reviews.author: Martin
reviews.body: Was a little hesitant to order because I didn't think coffee in a berliner would taste any good. I'm glad I got a can because it was really good, nice raspberry tartness with some roasty coffee notes to balance it out.

reviews.author: Patrick
reviews.body: When I went to drink this, I was not expecting it to be as delectable as it was. Truly a treat, a rare form of sour in a can that is very refreshing, not too acidic, and provides interesting enough flavors to keep wanting more instead of many of these one-sided, dull versions of a "raspberry" sour.. Impressed.

reviews.author: Brendan
reviews.body:
Coffee and Berliner you say, TRUST, this is a sure fire winner! 

Made with a coffee company that is no longer around! Miss you 2nd Craft!

Highly recommended purchase! YOU WONT REGRET IT!

name: Mike Hess Hop Cloud Hazy IPA
description: Hop Cloud, the first of our Hazy IPAs, starts with a classic malt riff of 2-row, oats, and wheat, then we rain down furious gobs of late-addition hops. The result is an unfiltered pineapple, mango, and citrus hop-tacular, with almost no perceived bitterness. It's a party for your senses—tongues and noses rejoice!

name: Mikkeller San Diego Humle Nørd Hazy IPA
description: NE IIPA with Galaxy Hops

reviews.author: Seyed M.
reviews.body: Nice smooth Ipa

reviews.author: Brendan .
reviews.body: Out of this world - Galaxy Hops Galore !!!

name: Mike Hess Grapefruit Solis IPA

reviews.author: Jamie C.
reviews.body: Good beer. Could use stronger grapefruit taste. Would buy again.

name: Mike Hess Claritas
description: Claritas is our 2016 World Beer Cup–winning Kölsch ale. This refreshingly smooth, authentically German beer is light straw in color, infused with light fruit and bready aromatics from the German Pilsner malt, hops, and yeast. The result is a smooth and dry ale with a refreshingly clean finish.

reviews.author: BD
reviews.body:
1" eggshell white head with good staying power and a slow move down to a solid cap. Straw gold color with a slight haze. Thick, sticky lacing.
Grainy (feed store) and bready malt nose up front. Hint of floral or grassy hops. Simple and smells very good.
Bready, lightly sweet malt with enough hop to balance, there's a touch of tree fruit (apple or pear maybe) but nothing out of bounds. 
Clean, light body, medium carbonation. Dry finish with a light lingering bitterness. Good drinkability, refreshing. Well done.
Very good.

reviews.author: Marisa D.
reviews.body: I've loved this one since I first had it at their Miramar tap room. Sweet and light with a decent malt backbone, this is a crushable Hess classic.

reviews.author: Andrew
reviews.body: A beer that could go with any meal, or none at all; as great of a porch sipper as it is in the beer hall. ****** and tasty.

name: Mike Hess Habitus Double IPA
description: Habitus, winner of the 2014 World Beer Cup℠ in the Rye category, is a spicy, crisp, and extremely drinkable double IPA. We use loads of Sterling and Chinook hops in the kettle and hopback (and even more during the dry hop) for intense pine aromatics accentuated by a rye and 2-row malt base for a truly great IPA experience.

reviews.author: BD
reviews.body:
Deep golden / copper color IIPA with good clarity. 1 finger off white head with decent retention leaves behind clingy lacing and holds as a solid cap.
This is a unique nose that's hard to describe. Some of it's uniqueness is the rye malt bill I believe and a spicy/herbal hop component that pushes the "spicy" element sky high in the nose. Also a sharp twang that isn't fruity or piney as a hop type descriptor.
Very high tone flavor pushing a varnish quality. Pine bitterness. 
Spicy is there but a little overwhelmed by the initial flavors.
Medium body and carbonation. Lingering bitterness and a dry finish.
Very unique aroma and flavors - probably not for me.
Good.

reviews.author: Chad B.
reviews.body: A little too malty & grassy for me but not bad.

name: Mikkeller San Diego Beer Geek Breakfast
description: Oatmeal Stout with Dark Horse Coffee.

reviews.author: Kenneth w.
reviews.body: nice strong flavor. go for it!

reviews.author: Seyed
reviews.body: I've had this on draft once, I was pleasantly surprised how good it was in a can aswell.

reviews.author: Ryan
reviews.body: The beer was beyond my expectation

reviews.author: Seth
reviews.body:
Do you like coffee? Do you like Guinness? If so, this beer is for you. It a very high quality beer that does exactly what it says as a coffee stout.

However, I have to give it 4 stars because it's just not unique. It's a very good coffee stout but I can find 20 more very good coffee stouts.

reviews.author: Brendan
reviews.body: You like coffee? You like stout? Marry them both and you have this fine release! Delicious and the price is absolutely frekin right!!

name: Maui Pineapple Mana Wheat

reviews.author: Richard A.
reviews.body:
I enjoyed this beer very much. The pineapple flavor wasn’t too sweet, and it complimented the wheat beer very well.

Cheers,
Rich

reviews.author: Tim R.
reviews.body: I crushed about 15 of these during my Honeymoon in Hawaii. A tasty, smooth delight in a can.

reviews.author: Charles D.
reviews.body: Not bad at all for a flavored beer!

reviews.author: Tony
reviews.body: An incredible wheat bear with a small hint of pineapple. The taste brought me right back to Maui.

name: Maui Coconut Porter
description: A robust dark ale with hand-toasted coconut and hints of mocha.

reviews.author: CARMELA G.
reviews.body: At first I was hesitant because I have never tried any beer with coconut flavor. However, this Porter blew my mind!! Thanks Craft Shack!!

reviews.author: Heather
reviews.body: I was expecting more coconut from a coconut beer from Hawaii. But it wasn't really there, very disappointed and sticking with Oskar Blues.

reviews.author: Bob
reviews.body: Decent porter but I didn’t really get the coconut. More of a mocha taste.

reviews.author: CHRISTL
reviews.body: Nice drinking beer- reminds me of vacation

name: Maui Mosaic Lite IPA
description: Session version of Mosaic Mo Betta

name: Maui Big Swell IPA

reviews.author: Kurtis
reviews.body: Quite possibly my favorite IPA. Great balance of hoppiness and bitterness while still having a great flavor

name: Left Hand Milk Stout NITRO

reviews.author: Raffi A.
reviews.body:
Bold creamy flavor with a nice finish ... it's real good with beef, game or on its' own.
Keep it in stock.
Thx

reviews.author: Jesse B.
reviews.body: Left Hand Nitro Milk Stout was one of the first of its kind to enter the market, and its still one of the best! Super creamy body with roasty notes of chocolate and coffee, finishing smooth and sweet.

reviews.author: Patrick
reviews.body: This was actually really impressive. I was expecting an overbearing, boozy taste like most heavy beers, but this was mainly coffee focused and had notes of toffee/chocolate milk coming thru. The carbonation was neat, allowed me to sip on it for quite some time and see how the flavors warped thru heat change without going flat. If you like stouts at all, I am sure you would enjoy this.

name: Latitude 33 Mangoveza IPA
description: In tribute to our southern neighbors, we crafted an unparalleled contrast of sweet and heat with Mangoveza. Fruity bitterness upfront followed by a burst of habanero warmth provides a well-balanced IPA—unlike any other spicy ale. Come explore the uncharted territories of this invigorating IPA.

name: Latitude 33 Native Trails Coffee Coconut Porter
description: Native Trails, a rotating experiment, is taking an adventurous turn towards the roasty roads of toasted coconut and coffee by collaborating with Steady State Coffee. This delicious, limited brew has traces of sweetness while keeping the rich mouthfeel of an American porter. We brought in Steady State's premium specialty coffees Space Traveler and Sipi Falls by blending them together for a perfect pairing. This coffee blend has bright complexity with nice floral accents, followed by a rounded body with chocolate notes that makes for the perfect brew.

name: Left Hand Hard Wired NITRO Coffee Porter
description: ﻿Innately predisposed to be smooth when Poured Hard, this nitro coffee porter builds a pillowy, toffee-sweet head. Coffee and flavors of caramelized sugar, cacao and hints of blueberry lead to a light, smoky finish.

reviews.author: John Z.
reviews.body: It was rich and creamy with a nice coffee flavor. Not too strong or weak, flavorful porter.

name: Latitude 33 Blood Orange IPA
description: Juicy and refreshingly delicious, our Blood Orange IPA redefines the category of the San Diego style IPA. While it is infused with blood orange, this IPA is not too sweet. The citrusy, tropical bitterness provides a perfect balance and a sweet finish.

reviews.author: Jason O.
reviews.body: Sweet orange flavor. Very drinkable

reviews.author: Bryan Y.
reviews.body: This is my favorite beer! So smooth, tasty and has the right amount of flavor! Please continue to brew!

reviews.author: michael d.
reviews.body: This is an awesome.IPA from San Diego..smooth blend of.orange doesnt overwhelm..kickass!

reviews.author: Bryan Y.
reviews.body: By far the best blood orange IPA on the market! I hope they make more!

reviews.author: Andrew
reviews.body: Excellent blend of orange and IPA without diluting it down to a watery juice-like. Non-IPA fans might even love it, the blend is so well done. Probably in my top 3 orange brews.

name: Lagunitas Hazy Wonder IPA
description: A Bright Spectacle of a hazy IPA featuring Comet, Citra, & Cashmere hops.

name: American Solera Power TIPA
description: TIPA w/ citra and mosaic hops

name: Avery Liliko'i Kepolo Passionfruit Witbier
description: Belgian style wheat infused with copius amount of passion fruit

reviews.author: Claire .
reviews.body: Nice hit of passion fruit flavor, one of my favorite fruits! The punchy passion fruit pairs well with the smooth Belgian wheat style beer. Delicious :)

reviews.author: Jason
reviews.body: As you take your first sip you immediately taste the spices that are soon followed with passionfruit coriander and orange peel. A perfect blend of fruit and tart

name: Avery Our Core Team Variety Pack
American Solera Magic Touch DIPA
description: DIPA with Kohatu and Moutere hops. You could call it a mango smoothie if you don’t like beer.

name: Latitude 33 Lost Cities Hazy IPA
description: We stumbled upon this hazy wonder while navigating through the fog of San Diego’s craze for haze. When the clouds clear, Lost Cities Hazy IPA exposes peaks of flavor erupting with juicy citrus—leaving a desire to experience more unparalleled haze. It may be concealed, but this adventurous brew is waiting to be discovered.

reviews.author: Robert
reviews.body: This is a smooth hazy IPA with a clean finish. I don't taste overwhelming hops and it has a nice orangey/pine finish. Would definitely buy a 6 pack in the store if I stumbled across it

reviews.author: Will
reviews.body: One of my new favorite hazy ipa’s

reviews.author: Joseph
reviews.body: solid! would definitely get again!

reviews.author: Scott
reviews.body: Go to hazy ipa. Outstanding job.

reviews.author: adam S.
reviews.body: The latitude 33 was a great hazy ipa. Sweet and not in your face too much. Nice smooth finish. Good alcohol content. Overall a very nice beer I would drink again.

name: Area Two 2020 Urban Funk Sour
description: Urban Funk is fermented using a one-of-a-kind mix of wild yeast captured during Superstorm Sandy. Fermented in concrete and aged in steel tanks, it's a totally sour, funky and experimental brew!

name: Alpine HFS IPA
description: Mosaic, Citra and Simcoe hops

name: Alpine Nelson IPA

reviews.author: Nichole E.
reviews.body: My co-worker is a big beer collector, specifically IPAs and she was so excited to get this from me. Amazing beer

reviews.author: Dustin H.
reviews.body: I love Nelson hops and this beer did not disappoint.

reviews.author: doug f.
reviews.body:
Been waiting a long time for this highly sought after RyePA to re-emerge. Nelson lived up to it reputation and the BeervAdvocate reviews
 Get some!!!!!!

name: Alpine Duet IPA

reviews.author: Craig M.
reviews.body: It is very good.

name: Almanac Unfiltered Opinion
description: Unfiltered Opinion is low on bitterness, but high on flavor and personality. Brewed as a Northeast-style IPA, this hoppy beer explodes with unsolicited Simcoe and Mosaic aromas of lime zest, mango, and blueberry. Juicy, cloudy, and opionated, this hazy IPA doesn’t hold back on anything except bitterness.

reviews.author: Elizabeth
reviews.body: Crisp, bitter, tropical, refreshing

name: Almanac True Kolsch
description: German Kölsch-Style Ale

name: Almanac Sunshine & Opportunity
description: Mixed fermentation saison, aged in oak barrels with pear juice. A delicate dry-hop of Sabro, Citra, and Mosaic imparts a transcendent tropical aroma in every sip.

reviews.author: justin
reviews.body: Good sour with nice background flavor

name: Almanac Love Hazy IPA
description: LOVE is a head-over-heels hazy brew bursting with hoppy tropical flavors. Built on a simple base of pilsner malt and rolled oats, this super dank IPA has a pillowy mouthfeel and is double dry-hopped with Citra, Mosaic and Simcoe. Flavors of mango, cantaloupe, and citrus will keep you infatuated. LOVE is all you need.

reviews.author: Patrick
reviews.body: Almanac consistently brings fire brews to the table. Anytime I see them available, I make sure to stock up. Can never go wrong with anything they put out. Cheers

reviews.author: Danielle H.
reviews.body: Pretty good hazy IPA. To me it had a bit of a funny taste but my friend really loved it.

reviews.author: Bert F.
reviews.body: I enjoyed this Hazy IPA a bit more than the LOUD. It is crisp and refreshing. Very smooth and found myself wanting another, and another

reviews.author: Aaron
reviews.body: Tropical-forward with complementing resin. Mango and melon flavors come through. Refreshing and tasty.

reviews.author: Eugene
reviews.body: We had it a little less fresh, but could still tell it's pretty well-balanced.

reviews.author: Margaret T.
reviews.body: I like to try new beers and most of the time I'm disappointed, this beer was spot on its description. I highly recommend it for those looking for a crisp taste.

reviews.author: Lora B.
reviews.body: Tasty & The can design just caught my eye. I was hoping it was good & I wasn't disappointed.

reviews.author: Brian
reviews.body: Still one of my favorite lagers

reviews.author: Carl
reviews.body: Like other reviewers said, it is like a Corona, Sol, or Landshark. It is smooth and easy to drink. Great for a hot summer day. If it was a larger can, might be something I would consider buying more frequently.

reviews.author: Kristen
reviews.body: Not much exciting about this beer. While it's very easy to drink, especially on those 100 degree NC summer days, it doesn't taste much different than a Corona. I wouldn't buy it again, but I'd be ok with someone bringing me a six pack and leaving it.

name: Almanac Cherry Sournova
description: Sour ale aged in oak barrels with cherries and vanilla bean

reviews.author: Todd J.
reviews.body: Another very good addition to the Almanac sour series. Ranks among the top of those out there.

reviews.author: Brendan
reviews.body: Cherries galore! Sour but not overly tart! Superbly well done!

reviews.author: Tyler
reviews.body: More sour than anything. Kind’ve a letdown in the vanilla department. There a woodsy taste from the barrels. Okay at best.

name: Almanac LOUD! Hazy DIPA
description: LOUD! Hazy Double IPA always uses its outside voice. Obnoxiously dry-hopped with Mosaic and Denali, LOUD! screams with tropical flavors of mango, papaya and pineapple and has a crazy hazy mouthfeel.

reviews.author: Ronald H.
reviews.body: Amazing Is all that comes to mind after my first sip! Hands down the best DIPA I've had to date. Great job Almanac beer company!

reviews.author: Paul
reviews.body: I really like this IPA. Very hazy and fruity/juicy. Definitely will buy again

reviews.author: Peter K.
reviews.body: Good DIPA. Not as hazy as some of the others, but good hop flavor and nice finish

reviews.author: Will
reviews.body: This drink was pretty good nice aroma. It tasted really good you get a nice tropical bite, and citrus.

reviews.author: thomas f.
reviews.body: Really enjoyed this one. I don’t give out 5 stars easily, but this one is deserving of 4 stars. Great tasting and finish throughout. Would purchase again.

name: AleSmith Juice Stand

reviews.author: Robert
reviews.body: I will start by saying, overall, this is a pretty good ipa! A good amount of hops, subtle taste of citrus. I will say, however, that it isn't as hazy as I was expecting, especially for a beer called 'juice stand' but I'd probably order this beer again in my rotation given my new expectations.

reviews.author: Lindsey
reviews.body: I love hazy and milkshake IPAs and I found this one lacking in the haze department. It was great if I wasn’t expecting it to be a hazy IPA.

reviews.author: Pete
reviews.body: Good beer but not compared to other hazy IPAs. Not as juicy or thick as others in this category.

reviews.author: Will
reviews.body: This ipa was pretty average, the flavors were pretty muted and but it’s very hoppy not one of my particular favorites but it’s aromatic and has a nice after taste

reviews.author: Will
reviews.body: I enjoyed this ipa, it was nice and smooth but also had straight my flavors

name: AleSmith Speedway Stout
description: Speedway Stout is a HUGE Imperial Stout, with pounds and pounds of coffee added during conditioning for a little extra kick! This will definitely get you racing! Appearance: Jet Black, with a toast-brown head. Flavor: Starts with a strong coffee and dark chocolate sensation, then fades to a multitude of toasty, roasty and caramelly flavors. Finishes with a nice fullness but dry enough not to be cloying. Aroma: COFFEE! And some other stuff. And coffee. Mouthfeel (body/texture): Velvety smooth texture. Clean and crisp, full-bodied. Warmth from the high alcohol content lightens up the feel a bit. Still, you won't fool your taste buds -- this beer is HUGE!

reviews.author: Donna C.
reviews.body: The best of the best. Never had a better stout. Highly recommended

reviews.author: Michael H.
reviews.body: Refreshing taste with a little kick. Smooth

reviews.author: Eugene
reviews.body: A little oily.

reviews.author: Andrew
reviews.body: Dark like night, thick, and creamy.

reviews.author: Robert G.
reviews.body: Loved this beer for years! One of the all-time best to sit back and enjoy!

name: AleSmith San Diego Pale Ale .394

reviews.author: Danielle
reviews.body: "Smells like a West Coast IPA. Taste a lot like a West Coast IPA."

name: AleSmith Forgeberry Sour
description: This deliciously fruity creation combines the sweetness of raspberries with a bright tartness and refreshing drinkability, all within 120 calories per serving.

name: Abnormal Mocha Stout
description: Collaborating with other like minded businesses will be an important part of this brewery. For this beer we team up with locally based Mostra Coffee Roasters. After brewing this oatmeal milk stout with Guana Cacao Nibs from San Francisco's TCHO Chocolatier we cold steep Mostra's Fortissimo Espresso with the beer for 24 hours before packaging. At 5.1% ABV this beer is defies the perception that dark beers are only big, bold, and too alcoholic to enjoy.

name: Abnormal Hopsalada
description: Our take on the classic West Coast style IPA. Assertive bitterness, a solid malt backbone, and layers of hop character. We add hops more than a few times during the boil with multiple varieties to create a harmonious balance of aromas and flavors. It finishes clean and tight with a soft bitterness and notes of classic citrus and pine. An easy drinking American IPA brewed with a plethora of hops, unfolding an insanely crisp & clean hop finish.

name: Abnormal / Pink Boots Abnormally Pink Double IPA
description: Happy International Women’s Day!⁣⁣We brewed a double IPA with Pink Boots Society and YCH to celebrate all the badass women out there!⁣

reviews.author: Just i.
reviews.body: Good flavor profile. Easy drinking too

name: Abnormal Hazy Dreams

reviews.author: John E.
reviews.body: Nice NEIPA Juicy and citrusy Hoppy

reviews.author: Scott
reviews.body: This is a fantastic Hazy. Sucks you in from the beauty in a glass and from start to finish a great taste the whole way through! I highly recommend this baby!

reviews.author: Brendan
reviews.body: Really enjoyed this beer quite a bit! Recommended buying. You won’t be disappointed!

reviews.author: Brendan
reviews.body: Quality again! Citrusy and juicy fresh! Get it!

name: Abnormal Boss Pour IPA
description: In Southern California, we like our IPAs dry, light in color, aromatic, & packed with hop flavor. "Boss Pour IPA" was created to achieve just that. Simcoe, whole leaf Cascade, Nelson Sauvin, & Citra hops give it a heavy dank aroma that you can smell a few feet away.

reviews.author: Chris .
reviews.body: Nice California IPA-wouid order again.

reviews.author: Brendan
reviews.body: Definitely a worthy purchase! Fruity & hoppy forward experience!

name: 21st Amendment Hell or High Watermelon Wheat

reviews.author: Joseph C.
reviews.body: This drink is amazing. The mesh of the two opposite flavors work well together.

reviews.author: Heather I.
reviews.body: It’s a good flavor beer.

name: Robinsons Trooper Ale (Iron Maiden Beer)
description: "Trooper takes its name from the Iron Maiden song which is inspired by the famous Charge of the Light Brigade. Being a real ale enthusiast, vocalist Bruce Dickinson has developed a beer which has true depth of character.Trooper is a Premium British Beer inspired by Iron Maiden and handcrafted at Robinsons brewery. Malt flavours and citric notes from a unique blend of Bobec, Goldings and Cascade hops dominate this deep golden ale with a subtle hint of lemon."

reviews.author: Devan
reviews.body: Smooth, light and refreshing

reviews.author: Jason S.
reviews.body: Descent beer and tasty ESB.

reviews.author: Mark
reviews.body: So far I'm 3 for 3 the beer that I have bought have been great I've never had a British beer before but this is very good beer makes me want to be an alcoholic.

name: Revision Social Fermentation
description: It’s fun to party with your friends. The gang’s all here in this highly drinkable Northeast IPA. Citra and Mosaic of course, and our buddy Amarillo, life of the party Galaxy and recent addition to the squad Vic Secret. Hang out, drink up, and party on.

reviews.author: Jennifer
reviews.body: This is a hazy New England IPA. Citra and Mosaic hops make this a juicy and there are also Amarillo, Galaxy and Vic Secret hops. This is so flavorful from the rich scent to the mouth-feel to the great finish, smooth and satisfying. You will not regret hanging with this gang of hops.

reviews.author: Brent T.
reviews.body: Revision killing it

name: Revision Staff Of Life
description: We all need a little help on the way, some support while briefly traveling through this world. More than a walking stick, the Staff of Life lifts your spirits with a blend of Mosaic, Equinox and CTZ over a pillowy malt base. Smooth yet packed full of hop flavah and aroma, this is the refreshing beverage to quaff on the journey to the promise land.

reviews.author: Joshua
reviews.body: This beer has a full, layered flavor but not so bitter to punch you in the face. If you're int he mood for a big beer with wide-range hops flavor, this is it.

reviews.author: Timothy
reviews.body: Surprised by this beauty! Citrus and dank explode out of the can. A stellar brew!

reviews.author: Collin
reviews.body: Good beer, all around great DPA. Another solid hit from Revision

name: Revision Revision IPA
description: Low impact bitterness, high impact aroma and flavor. Simcoe lays the hop foundation for this extremely delicious, flavorful and quaffable American India Pale Ale. Tropical citrus, orange and pine flavors meld seamlessly.

reviews.author: John K.
reviews.body: Very drinkable.

reviews.author: justin
reviews.body: This beer taste like hops you use to brew with....buy it you wont be disappointed

reviews.author: Collin
reviews.body: Good IPA. All around delicious

name: Revision Leafy Greens

reviews.author: Dan A.
reviews.body: Great beer, get some before it’s gone

reviews.author: Monique G.
reviews.body: I really enjoyed this once. Light, crisp, refreshing and dank.

name: Revision Snarf Snarf
description: A special dose of character malt adds schweet, schweet flavah while a combination of old and new school hops provides orange marmalade, grapefruit and forest aromas and tastes.

reviews.author: Brent T.
reviews.body: Nohm nohm yum yum snarf snarf

name: Revision Invitation To Party
description: Hey Bear, looks like you had a good time. Guess what, today is a new day and we're gonna slay it again. Sabro brings the tropic thunder with hop flavors and aromas of ripe pineapple and a touch of coconut, while Vic Secret lends distinct citrus character, all floating on a pillowy malt cushion.

reviews.author: Ken H.
reviews.body: Nice tropical flavor nice hazy look drinks smooth. But, has a bit a weird aftertaste that I couldn’t shake

reviews.author: Patrick
reviews.body: Hiding that ABV so well underneath pillowy, juicy hops :') the type of beer that makes you wanna cry it's so beautifully crafted

reviews.author: Kyle
reviews.body: Great tasting DIPA.

reviews.author: justin
reviews.body: I dont think I've had a bad brew by these guys. Hard to notice the 8.5 percent alcohol. Has good flavor too.

name: Protector Organic Citra Juicy Double IPA
description: Juicy with an amazing Citra and Mosaic hoppy flavor and aroma. Clean bitterness and a nice, crisp finish.

reviews.author: Denny A.
reviews.body: Very tasty recomend highly

name: Revision Moon Wolf IPA
description: Brightly lit by Mosaic and Mandarina Bavaria hops dropping notes of berries, tangerine and mango, this brew lays down a foundation of malt, wheat and oats soft and pillowy enough to pad your den.

reviews.author: BD
reviews.body:
1" white head with a perfectly straight edge collar sits above a glowing orange and perfectly opaque IPA. Very good retention and leaves behind a thick, fresh lacing. 
Clean citrus aromas, orange peel and berries with cream, mango - touch of pine and a creamy / creamsicle malt base lean.
Big berry flavor up front followed by a peel/rind flavor and the fresh oils of citrus skin. Very juicy. Very, very juicy.
Full body, smooth and soft mouthfeel. Nice punch of bitterness mid-palate that hangs for awhile. Long tropical and citrus flavors in the finish.
Outstanding.
7th beer I've had from Revision, all fantastic.

name: Pizza Port Sidewalk Surfin'
description: Sultana, Simcoe, Citra, & Columbus hops.

name: Pizza Port Ponto SIPA

reviews.author: Paul
reviews.body: I thought this beer was pretty nice for a session, not overly hoppy. Easy drinking.

name: Pizza Port Swami's IPA
description: Swami’s IPA is a special beer to the Pizza Port family as it was the first IPA brewed in our original location over 20 years ago in Solana Beach. With a more traditional hop profile, this beer is the quintessential example of a West Coast IPA as it showcases the fresh bitterness of citrus and pine. Swami’s is named after one of the most famous surf breaks in San Diego county, which, as perfectly depicted on the can, is always crowded with surfers and paddle boarders alike. The break itself gets its name from its proximity to a Self-Realization Fellowship, a landmark in Encinitas that is also perfectly pictured on the can. Whatever your form of meditation is, we hope that each and every sip contributes to your own self-realization! Hops: Chinook, CTZ, Cascade, Centennial, Citra, Simcoe

reviews.author: Phillip T.
reviews.body: Pours out of the can a nice clear golden yellow color with a fluffy off white head. Nice lemon forward, citrus-y nose to it. Piney, juicy tropical citrus flavors can be tasted right off the back, followed by a slightly malty hoppy taste.

reviews.author: Jon K.
reviews.body: Decent West Coast IPA. First beer I have tried from Pizza Port and looking forward to tasting some of their other brews.

reviews.author: Frank M.
reviews.body: Swami’s is an OG WCIPA.

reviews.author: Amethyste S.
reviews.body: The best there is!

reviews.author: David L.
reviews.body: Nice IPA, but was better when I was enjoying it in SoCal at the beach. There is lot of competition in this style. You have to try out their pizza!!

name: Perennial Prodigal
description: Prodigal is an imperial oatmeal milk stout with a massive fudge and roast malt character. It’s a foundation for some of our favorite stouts, now here to stand on its own adorned with only a handful of cacao nibs and Madagascar vanilla beans to round out the edges.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.body: Rich taste, good mouth feel. Overall all good beer. Would definitely buy again

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.body: Great mouth feel with lots of lucious flavors a

reviews.author: Martin
reviews.body: Very good and fudgy with a nice hint vanilla

reviews.author: Brendan
reviews.body: Highly recommended purchase! You can’t go wrong with this release!

reviews.author: Anthony
reviews.body: This one isn't terrible for a non-BA stout. It's not too thin and has some good flavors. Can be cellared until 2020, but I drank it sooner.

name: Pizza Port Kook Double IPA

reviews.author: Ryan T.
reviews.body: Pizza Port masters another west coast style ipa. Simple and smooth, well-balanced and a delight to the palate. Could drink this all day.

reviews.author: Patrick
reviews.body: True to the style--smooth and well rounded, certainly not a haze bomb but my palate still enjoyed it :)

reviews.author: Darryl
reviews.body: Lots of grapefruit, pineapple and citrus, with a dash of pine for good measure. And pretty darned easy drinking for a beer of 8.5%.

reviews.author: Jeffrey R.
reviews.body: Is this the same Port Brewery that has been around for many years? They made some good brews.

reviews.author: Kristen
reviews.body: Very smooth double IPA, great early fall beer.

name: pFriem IPA
description: When the first pale ales were sailed around the cape to arrive in India in the early 18th center, outcries of "Zounds!", "Jolly good!", and "Huzzah!" were heard across the East Indian subcontinent. Similar exclamations are to be expected when sniffing the piney aroma and tasting the big hops, huge citrus, and candy-like malt of Pfriem's own IPA. Drink up, guv'nor.

reviews.author: Woody R.
reviews.body: I’m usually a Hazy IPA drinker, but being a former Oregonian, I enjoyed this immensely! Easy drinking, not too hoppy and quite smooth

reviews.author: Lawrence B.
reviews.body: pFriem continues to impress with their solid lineup of beers. This IPA leaves a terrific lacing and has all the key elements of a NW IPA. Tropical, slight juicy feel, and just enough dankness. Definitely worth the purchase.

reviews.author: Anthony
reviews.body: Been so long since I had an IPA that I could see through. First IPA from pFriem. A solid 3.75/5.

name: Pizza Port Campgrounds IPA

reviews.author: Just i.
reviews.body: Sweet goodness best pizza port I've had

name: Pizza Port Chronic Ale
description: Historically brewed with hemp seeds, Chronic Ale has been a staple at Pizza Port for over a decade! This mellow amber ale is the most popular beer in all of our pub locations as it agrees with everyone’s palate and goes great with pizza. It was a dream come true to finally put it in a can and give people the chance to carry it with them wherever they go!

reviews.author: Patrick M.
reviews.body: Another great one from Pizza Port. Nice flavor and body for a lower ABV beer.

reviews.author: Jennifer B.
reviews.body: Love this beer. Its a good refreshing lighter beer that does not skip out on the full flavor like others. Great beer for a hot day!

reviews.author: Jen
reviews.body: This was a refreshingly light, smooth amber that is not over powered by hops. One of my favorites on a hot summer day.

reviews.author: Paul
reviews.body: nice amber! the malt shines in this one, not too hoppy but just enough to balance out the grain bill.

reviews.author: Adam N.
reviews.body: I enjoyed this amber ale from Pizza Port. It had a smooth and rich taste.

name: Perennial Coffee Stout (2020 Dark Matter Coffee)
description: For the full distribution batch, Tim and Phil selected a blend of two beans: The first is a washed coffee from the Santa Petrona farm in El Salvador. The second is from the San Jeronimo Miramar farm in Guatemala and was fermented with Bavarian Wheat Yeast.Brewed with a malt bill comprised of a bevy of European specialty malt and loads of flaked oats. With this rich stout base, the coffee melds with the caramel and chocolate malts to bring forward layers of chocolate cake and freshly brewed coffee, all wrapped up with a smooth yet boozy finish. This beer reminds us of putting chocolate sauce in your morning coffee, late night diner hangs, and early morning stout brewshifts.

reviews.author: Fred Hedge, Jr.
reviews.body: Tons of coffee. Very tasty!

reviews.author: Kenneth E.
reviews.body: Some of the best coffee stout I have tasted. The Dark Matter coffee is rich with chocolate and well balanced, very smooth. Highly recommended.

reviews.author: Brendan .
reviews.body: It tasted like a cold brew with a little beer added. Seriously, delightful & great beer to share!

reviews.author: Casey K.
reviews.body: wow. good condition!!!

name: OEC Coolship Lager
description: Coolship Lager crisp clean refreshing

name: Mother Earth Sin Tax Imperial Peanut Butter Stout
description: You know that feeling when something is so good, it has to be bad? Much like the sumptuary tax placed on the beverages we love so much, at times we feel we must cap ourselves in the wants and needs of our strongest desires. Desires like that of the full bodied and robust flavor of an imperial stout both dark and rich, paired with the creamy essence of peanut butter, twisting and tangling over your taste-buds until you truly comprehend that it just may be too heavenly NOT to be a sin.

reviews.author: Andrew
reviews.body: I expected something smoother and maybe creamier. Honestly, it doesn't even really taste like peanut butter - I can't even really place it. The taste isn't bad, but I'm disappointed a brewer like Mother Earth, who has done the excellent Cali Creamin' (which tastes exactly like a cream soda), couldn't nail this.

reviews.author: Robin
reviews.body: This stout was pretty disappointing when it came to the peanut butter flavor. Not a bad beer in general, but lacking the flavor I was hoping for.

name: New Holland Dragon's Milk White Stout
description: Dragon’s Milk White is a nod to New Holland Brewing’s 20 years of barrel-aging expertise and commitment to innovation in the name of flavor. The next legend to unfold in the Dragon’s Milk family, Dragon’s Milk White creates a full flavored, yet lighter stout drinking experience that presents familiar flavors in a completely unexpected way.

reviews.author: Thomas
reviews.body: The white stout was something I hadn't tried before tonight. It surprised me, I typically don't like beers I can see though I'm kind of a snob and I know it, this was really good it's still not a thick as a dark stout but it definitely tastes like a stout. Try it you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Marcie C.
reviews.body: White stouts are amazing

name: New English Zumbar Chocolate Coffee Imperial Stout

reviews.author: Marcie C.
reviews.body: What a delicious beer. I love Coffee Stouts and this chocolate coffee stout was amazing. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Steve
reviews.body: You must love coffee! If you do, you will really enjoy this beer, add alittle chocolate and you have an excellent brew!

reviews.author: Ben
reviews.body: Great beer! Pretty balanced and nice kick with the higher ABV. Very smooth and not boozy at all. Chocolate is not overpowering and very flavorful...just enough coffee to add to the flavor and not overpower this brew...definite must try!

reviews.author: Aaron S.
reviews.body: Great variety, especially loved the stout, which is my kind of beer. But all were very good, even though I don't typically like IPAs. Get this pack back I want to order it again!

reviews.author: Jessie B.
