reviews.body: I really am enjoying this selection! I purchased for the Cali Creamin’ which I have not been able to get locally any more. Cool, pop open and serve in a glass!

name: Mother Earth Hop Diggity Double IPA
Offshoot Relax [it's just a hazy IPA]
description: Relax [it’s just a hazy IPA] embraces the new way to enjoy IPA - unfiltered, fresh and full of hop flavor and aromatics... without the bitterness to stand in the way of kicking back with a juicy beer. It features a combination of Citra, Centennial, Simcoe and Amarillo hops, imparting fruity, tropical and citrusy notes to complement the round, soft mouthfeel of a hazy IPA.

reviews.author: Jon K.
reviews.body: Excellent, smooth IPA with refreshing finish.

reviews.author: Dan
reviews.body: This is one of the best hazys I've ever had to be totally honest. Nice soft mouth feel, awesome bouquet of hops

reviews.author: Eugene
reviews.body: Very juicy. Like it.

reviews.author: Tony
reviews.body: This is my go-to everyday hazy. Smooth, crisp, clean.

reviews.author: Kyle
reviews.body: Delicious hazy if you can get it fresh, as with most hazy ipas...

name: Untitled Art / 608 Brewing Cloudy IPA
description: Collaboration with 608 Brewing , hope our cloudy will bring you sunshine!!

name: Two Roads Two Juicy Hazy IPA
description: Two Juicy is an unfiltered, cloudy “New England style Double IPA” that uses generous amounts of Hallertauer Blanc, Citra & Mandarina Bavaria hops. The result is a “juicy”, fully-charged DIPA with notes of grapefruit, pine, lychee, orange & tangerine against a soft malt backdrop.

reviews.author: BD
reviews.body:
1 finger white head with decent retention down to a cap. Pale yellow/orange opaque NEIPA. Minimal lacing.
Light citrus notes, coconut and/or herbal woodsy note, floral, orange rind, hint of fuel. 
Really nice subtle (but complex) nose.
Citrus - oranges and white grapefruit. Mango. Zingy, zesty fruit flavors in the finish add to the uniqueness and enjoyability.
Smooth mouthfeel, medium body and low to medium perceived carbonation. Soft bitterness and a medium length off dry finish.
Very good to Outstanding.

name: Modern Times Themisto Hazy IPA
description: Themisto IPA is a juicy, hazy delight, featuring an abundance of Citra, El Dorado, Nelson, and Amarillo radness. Consuming this 6.5% seasonal wonder is a like lounging on a pineapple floatie of tropical splendor in a pool of pure refreshment while a subtle, peachy breeze ruffles your hair.

name: Untitled Art Dry Hop Peach Sour
description: Citra, Mosiac, Huell Melon Hops brewed 3,500 pounds of peach puree

name: Untitled Art / Listermann Tangerine Milkshake IPA
description: Brewed with Mandarin Tangerine Puree & milk sugar

name: Toppling Goliath Pseudo Sue

reviews.author: Tyler D.
reviews.body: I’ve been wanting to try this one for awhile. The citra hops are great! Juicy with a hint of mango and a small hop bite.

reviews.author: William T.
reviews.body: Toppling Goliath Brewing has developed a cult following here in the Midwest. Strong citrus (grapefruit) and pine . . . Nice pale ale distraction from an all IPA drinker.

reviews.author: Greg E.
reviews.body:
It's definitely a well made beer. Pretty fresh too, within a couple months of canning. 
No obvious flaws or off flavors. If you're into the hazy IPA trend. You'll probably like it.

reviews.author: James S.
reviews.body: Pseudo Sue should be any craft beer fan’s introduction to Toppling Goliath. Lots of juicy hops in this one!

reviews.author: Frank
reviews.body: Been putting this beer off for a while but definitely worth the try. Will buy it again. Easy going semi light beer for 6.8.

name: Mother Earth Boo Koo IPA
Toppling Goliath Pompeii
description: Influenced by the preserved mosaics buried under the ash of Mount Vesuvius, Pompeii is our single hop mosaic IPA. It houses mango and pineapple flavors with a medium-bodied feel and bright tones to tantalize the palate.

reviews.author: Franco M.
reviews.body: My first time trying it but it was a very enjoyable. My father liked this one best out of my last order. I'll certainly buy this again.

name: Topa Topa / Burgeon Heaps! Hazy IPA
description: Collaboration with Burgeon Beer. This unconventional IPA was brewed with zero hops on brew day. Yep! That's right. No hops in the kettle or whirlpool. Not to fear, bright aromas of dried mango, lime and honeydew come from the absurdly massive dry-hop additions added post-fermentation.

name: The Bruery Goses Are Red 2019
description: This is a rosé - and a gose - by any other name. Goses are Red is a stylish funky, crisp and tart gose ale inspired by the soft sweetness of a rosé wine. The refreshing wheat-based ale begins with some of the qualities you’d expect from a gose, including coriander spicing and a light saltiness to complement the tartness imparted by our house cultures. But the story doesn’t end there - it builds in complexity, thanks to time spent in an oak foeder and the addition of grapes, which impart a refreshing character and color.

name: Toppling Goliath Nugmo IPA
description: Mosaic, Sabro, Simco, and Amarillo hops join forces to create a bouquet of tropical citrus and pineapple aromas. This bold, hop-forward IPA captivates the senses as you raise a glass in tribute to lord NugMo. May he bless your taste buds with a bounty of flavor.

reviews.author: Brendan .
reviews.body: Loads of hop aromas & full on citrusy juicy notes

name: Topa Topa Spectro Hazy IPA
description: peach - grapefruit - coconut

name: The Bruery Bakery: Cherry Pie
description: Slice into this bold barrel-aged imperial stout and experience the nostalgia-inducing aroma of a warm cherry pie. Full-bodied and smacking of freshly-picked tart cherries, rich artisan vanilla, cinnamon and hints of brown sugar. This bakery is open for business.

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.body: Bruery does a fabulous job. This beer is a bit too sweet but still great for the style.

reviews.author: Jascha N.
reviews.body: Very, very good. Tastes just like you'd expect. Try not to drink too cold, chilled is better to really being out the flavor. Extremely smooth and not overly boozy.

reviews.author: Thomas
reviews.body: This was a delicious take on a cherry pie it has notes of cinnamon with a nice cherry flavor.

name: To Ol Jule Maelk Imperial Milk Stout
description: In Denmark we are very fond of Christmas beers. In fact, most of December goes with drinking Christmas beers while chewing on fat duck, pork roast, red cabbage and herrings left in vinegar for months.Jule Mælk. Our so far strongest beer, bumped up to 15% ABV and loaded and loaded and loaded with lactose, just until it couldn’t get any more heavy. You could say this is the Foie Gras force-feeding edition of a beer. But then again, it is Christmas after all…Style:Imperial Sweet StoutMalts:Pale, Special B, Melanoidin, Chocolate, Smoked, Dark Crystal, Roasted Barley, Cassonade Sugar, LactoseHops:Tettnanger, Tomohawk, Sorachi Ace

reviews.author: Christopher H.
reviews.body: Great dessert beer. Almost a little too strong and sweet but good to share.

reviews.author: Aaron C.
reviews.body: Excellent beer with great taste. Well recommended.

name: Strung Out / Lucky Luke Brewing Variety 12 Pack - Armor and Devotion / Astrolux
Stone Soaring Dragon Imperial IPA
Sunriver Cocoa Cow - Chocolate Milk Stout
description: Milk sugar, cocoa nibs, and caramel malt build the rich, full body of this brew, with mild roasted notes coming from three varieties of chocolate malt. Have some dessert today - served in a glass!HOPS: ChinookOther Ingredients: Lactose, Cocoa Nibs

reviews.author: Hans G.
reviews.body: Good flavor this beer is on the lighter side

reviews.author: Mike G.
reviews.body: This is very chocolatey and smooth. Very enjoyable.

name: Stone / Metallica Enter Night Pilsner
description: It’s on. It’s time to get started. To crank things up. To get loud.That thumping you feel in your chest isn’t your imagination. It’s your heart. It’s life. It’s the rockin’ tunes. It’s your inspiration wanting to break out. It ain’t gonna sit there waiting, so mutherf**king grab it.This is a Collaboration in the truest sense between two entities that were born on the fringes. We’ve navigated life from a different perspective. We imagined things differently from what they were, and set about using our art to change the world according to our vision. We started being misunderstood by many, and loved by few. Today that’s the same...but that ‘few’ has become ‘more.’ A LOT more. That’s you, my friend, and we’re stoked you’re with us on this journey.The day is winding down. It’s time to get started. No more waiting. It’s time to get LOUD. It’s time to Enter Night.

reviews.author: Dan B.
reviews.body: Excellent beer!!

reviews.author: Daniel B.
reviews.body: This beer is smooth and is easy to drink. This beer from metallic will not disappoint drinkers. Very good experience.

reviews.author: Kenneth B.
reviews.body: Great Beer....love the can

reviews.author: Paul Q.
reviews.body: I love this beer. What a great collaboration between Metallica and Stone Brewing. Great tasting beer.

reviews.author: Henry J.
reviews.body: Great tasting beer. Stone brewery and Metallica getting together and creating a beer is perfect. Nothing better then drinking ENTER NIGHT and jamming out to Metallica.

name: Societe The Pupil
description: Accolades: Great American Beer Festival Bronze (2014), San Diego Union-Tribune Best San Diego IPA (2018), DRAFT Magazine Top 50 IPAs in America (2017), Los Angeles IPA Festival Peoples' Choice (2013), Los Angeles Beer Week Meeting of the Guilds Best Beer of the Day (2014), The Bistro IPA Festival Silver Medal (2013), Blind Lady Ale House IPA Challenge San Diego's Best (2013)Our easy-drinking Great American Beer Festival medal-winning India pale ale bursts with citrus and tropical-fruit aromas and flavors.He exhibits: Guava & Mango Tropicality, Crispness & Studiousness

reviews.author: ROGER M.
reviews.body: I first had it in Del Mar years ago and have since visited the brewery on every trip to San Diego to get a growler or two for the week. If I had to take one beer to a deserted island it would be this beer. It’s my all time favorite and I’m a IPA connoisseur.

name: Societe The Heiress Pilsner
description: Refreshing and effervescent with a fluffy head, our take on a classic Bohemian pilsner is earthy and floral with a clean, bitter finish.She exhibits: Noble Hoppiness, Dryness, Grassiness & Regality

name: Societe The Coachman
description: Accolades: Great American Beer Festival Gold (2018 & 2015), San Diego International Beer Festival Gold (2016), Paste Magazine World's Best Session IPAs (#7)We've won TWO Great American Beer Festival gold medals for packing intense hop presence (Mosaic, Citra & Simcoe) into this session IPA.He exhibits: Lemon-Rind Pithiness, Peachy Fruitiness, Evergreen Notes & Restraint

name: The Bruery Mash & Vanilla
description: Mash & Vanilla is an ode to a classic from The Bruery. A bourbon barrel-aged barleywine-style base provides a well-matured, oaky and sweet bourbon foundation, while the addition of vanilla beans brings prominent and savory vanilla sensation to the forefront of your palate with every sip. Enjoy fresh for the most full-bodied vanilla character.

name: Short Throw Green Tops DIPA
description: Brewed with Mosaic and Citra hops, graciously dry hopped with the same varietals.

name: Second Chance Tabula Rasa Toasted Porter

reviews.author: Frank T.
reviews.body: So good I must try toasted oats in my own porter brews now. The dry roasted nature of this beer is utmost perfection in both aroma and quaff.

reviews.author: Andrew
reviews.body: Immediately on finishing this tasty, smoky porter I wished I had a second and a third ordered. Don't hesitate, try one, but you'll wish you had ordered more. Even the scent is worth lingering over.

name: Sierra Nevada Hazy Little Thing IPA
description: As brewers, we get the privilege to sample our beers straight from the tanks in all their raw glory. Some beers need a little polishing to get ready to go out into the world, while others—the hop-heavy, rowdy, crowd-pleasers—should just be left alone. We wanted to share this brewery-only treat with you, so we present this Hazy Little Thing, our unfiltered, unprocessed IPA, straight from the tanks and into the can.

reviews.author: David B.
reviews.body: Smooth and really good, I liked this one

name: Sierra Nevada Fantastic Haze Imperial IPA
description: We were in search of something fantastic. Something juicy, something hazy, something ripe with notes of mango, melon and citrus. So we said, "Reason be damned," and filled our kettles with five hop varieties and loads of malt, oats and wheat. Some may call that absurd. We call it absurdly fantastic!Bittering Hops: Amarillo, Azacca, Chinook, Idaho 7, StrataMalts: Two-Row Pale, Wheat, OatsYeast: Ale yeastBeginning Gravity: 19.0° PlatoEnding Gravity: 3.0° Plato

name: Second Chance Over The Line Lager
description: “Over-the-Line Lager” is brewed with German pilsner malt and light floral German hops. It is cold and refreshing, goes great with fish tacos, and is best paired with warm sand, good friends and good times.

reviews.author: Brittany J.
reviews.body: Bit hoppy, just the right amount for a lager. Smooth and tasty.

name: Second Chance Seize the IPA

reviews.author: Jason
reviews.body: A solid workhorse WCIPA. A nice bitterness with a subtle malt backbone rounds out this hoppy IPA with nice citrus, darkness, and pine. A nice mix between old school hops (Centennial) and more modern ones like Citra that are crowd pleasers. Find it fresh, this is a perfect go-to daily drinker for the lupulin crazed.

name: Second Chance Disco Balloon Hazy IPA
description: Brewed with Idaho 7, Mosaic and Ekuanot hops. From the moment you pop open the first disco balloon, expect nothing short of juicy mouth candy. Keep the party rolling with this luscious and fluffy hazy.

name: Lagunitas Hazy Memory
description: We're going a bit blurry on this nebulous release...Hazy Memory is a cloudy IPA full of oats and smooth wheatly-esque-ish-ness, packed with some of the murkiest, juiciest, turbid Loral 291, Hallertau Blanc,Galaxy, and Citra hops. It's a huge flavor you won't forget!

reviews.author: Robyn T.
reviews.body: I wish this beer were available in my area! Worth every penny of the shipping, though!

name: Knee Deep Tahoe Deep
description: Cascade, Centennial and CTZ hops keep this Imperial IPA West Coast style, floral, fruit and citrus aromas, Tahoe Deep is the perfect beer to keep on hand for a trip to the lake.

name: Knee Deep Stoutello Chocolate Stout
Knee Deep Oopsie Dhazy!
description: Oopsie Dhazy! We forgot to filter and fine this ridiculously juicy New England-Inspired IPA! Served directly out of the fermenter for maximum flavor and aroma, you will taste flavors of juicy guava and ripe passionfruit that pair perfectly with it’s cracker-like malt profile. Take a sip and you will realize that this pillowy soft, velvety liquid was no accident! Best enjoyed fresh!

name: Second Chance Mulligan
description: Smooth caramel malt notes and light, earthy British hops combine for an easy drinking, malty red ale.

reviews.author: Darryl
reviews.body: I've ordered Mulligan a couple times now and will do so again and again. It's the first beer I ever tried from Second Chance Brewing as well as being one of the best Irish Reds I've ever tasted. It has loads of malty character and fruity notes which blend well with spicy hops.

name: Knee Deep Simtra Triple IPA

reviews.author: Alex
reviews.body: Poured hazy amber into a full sized thistle glass. Yes libby's makes them, Wish it was fresher, about 3.5 months old. Wonderful from start to finish. Easy hop nose, spicy bite, complex finish. In other words, pretty kick butt triple. :)

reviews.author: Thomas S.
reviews.body: Knee Deep is one of best craft beer brewers. Hoptologist put it on the map and they continue to put out outstanding IPA’s. Simtra is another IPA that is above the rest!

reviews.author: Paul
reviews.body: Packs a punch, but still leaves you wanting more and more and more!

reviews.author: Lindsay
reviews.body: This is one of my go to bombers. I always purchase this one when it is in stock! All the way around it’s a great tasting beer.

reviews.author: Lindsay E.
reviews.body: High IBU but not super hoppy. This one is great. Definitely leaves you with a little buzz!

name: Knee Deep Citra Lights
description: Light, Bright and full of flavor; you will love the insane drinkability of “Citra Lights” Pale Ale. A shimmering golden hue, and subtle biscuit-like malt flavors give way to a light and crisp citrus hop aroma. 100% Citra hopped, and 100% Crushable, this is your new “go-to” beer.

reviews.author: Patrick M.
reviews.body: Fuller and hoppier than expected. Great taste for a lower alcohol content beer.

reviews.author: Patrick M.
reviews.body: Very hoppy and delicious, with its own unique flavor. Definitely not typical. Loved it, just like most other KD brews.

name: Knee Deep Slooow Mo IPA
description: This light bodied, single hopped Mosaic IPA is bursting with aromas of ripe summer berries, citrus and passionfruit. Flavorful enough to sip, and smooth enough to crush.

reviews.author: Chad
reviews.body: Great straight forward old school IPA. Knee Deep never disappoints.

name: Hoof Hearted / Evil Twin Even More Tennis Elbow Imperial Stout
description: Double mashed imperial stout with hazelnut, coconut, and vanilla added

name: Knee Deep Citra Extra IPA
description: A single hopped, West Coast Style IPA with intense hop flavor and aroma’s. This is a citrus bomb that has grapefruit and passion fruit aroma’s with citrus lime flavors.

name: Harland Mosaic West Coast DIPA
description: A modern take on a California classic, the West Coast DIPA pops with aroma of pineapple, citrus, and pine. With a restrained bitterness, and a clean, dry finish, this beer is a DIPA for the weekend.

name: High Water Campfire Stout

reviews.author: John H.
reviews.body:
Smooth stout easy drinking not overly sweet 
I'LL DRINK THIS BEER AGAIN

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.body: It was a very smooth, with hint of smoke. Crushable all day drinking beer.

reviews.author: frank t.
reviews.body: Good beer in and of itself. Great aroma but I was expecting more of that s’mores feel on the taste. A touch more roasty than I’d like for this style

reviews.author: Ben
reviews.body: One of the best lower ABV stouts I have ever had! Can taste the marshmallow/ graham flavor! Not too sweet, nor is it heavy! Build a camp fire, pour it up and enjoy!

reviews.author: Robin R.
reviews.body: High Water Campfire Stout is a s'mores flavored stout that is unmatched. It is so good I ordered all of it that was in stock and fly it back from California any time I travel there. It actually tastes like s'mores, but isn't too sweet because it has a smokey finish!

name: Hoof Hearted / American Solera That's Living Outside The Fire Imperial Stout
description: double mashed imperial stout with vanila

name: Gunwhales Hawaiian Sling IPA
description: Farmhouse IPA - Foeder fermented with a wild saccharomyces Brux Trois yeast. Motueka / Mosaic hops

name: Ground Breaker Paddy Porter
description: Roast - coffee - dark fruit - medium body. We used medium roast Peruvian coffee provided by Equal Exchange Coffee PDX, dark roasted rice malt from Eckert Malting & Brewing and organic cacao nibs to develop a medium-body porter with a thick, creamy head. Fans of dark beer have reason to rejoice, your gluten-free porter has arrived.

name: Ground Breaker Inclusion Dry Hopped Pale Ale
description: Dry hopped pale ale

name: Gunwhales Orangewood Hazy IPA
description: A fully opaque Hazy IPA, built for those who love a creamsicle style juice bomb. Notes of citrus, tropical pineapple/papaya, and vanilla cake sweetness. A bit of Chinook in the whirlpool followed by a double dry hop of Amarillo, Cascade and Citra hops. Medium bodied with a rocky head, a pillowy mouthfeel and low carbonation. Smooth and refreshing.

name: Ground Breaker Olallie Ale
description: Blackberry rose-hip ale.

name: Ground Breaker Dark Ale
description: Our mild dark ale delivers caramel and light roasty flavors with hints of chocolate and dark fruits. Dark Ale is brewed with dark roasted rice malt, chestnuts, lentils and dark Belgian-style candi sugar. This dark and mild beer is fermented with English ale yeast. It is modestly bittered, with just enough hops to let its malt-forwardness shine.

name: Ground Breaker Amber Lager
description: A German-style amber lager. Clean flavor, fermented with the classic Weihenstephan yeast.

name: Garage Spiced Coconut Porter
description: A Robust Porter with Toasted Coconut, Vanilla, Cinnamon, and Ginger

name: Garage Island Mango Twist
description: This unfiltered American wheat beer will transport you to the tropics with coconut and pineapple notes along with tropical flavors.

name: Foreign Objects Transgression Culture: Honey Frangipane Imperial Stout
description: This is a hyper thick, creamy Imperial Stout brewed with massive amounts of soft malted oats, and flaked barley, and into which we then add heaps and piles of sweet sweet almond paste, aromatic vanilla beans, and local New York star thistle honey to complete the frangipane hyper-pastry dynamic!

name: Garage Cold Brew Milk Stout
description: It is so good that you may want to substitute your daily cup o’ joe with this beer that combines roasted malts with smooth coffee.

reviews.author: Ezekiel K.
reviews.body: Exactly as it says, a lot of delicious cold brew up front. A really easy drinking dark option.

reviews.author: Ryan B.
reviews.body: Great coffee stout

reviews.author: Kenneth E.
reviews.body: Great tasting coffee stout. Rick chocolate and coffee taste. Highly recommended.

reviews.author: Jesse
reviews.body: Great coffee flavor, not overly sweet. Not super bitter either.

reviews.author: Corey
reviews.body: The beer is coffee-rich, sweet and not bitter in the slightest. This is a favorite and the fact that I only managed to get two bottles *this year* speaks to its great flavor. May be too sweet for some - think Thai Coffee - but for me it's the cat's pajamas.

name: Garage Marshmallow Milk Stout

reviews.author: Ryan b.
reviews.body: It’s alright. Don’t taste the marshmallow but still decent.

reviews.author: Eugene
reviews.body: Light but still with nice chocolate.

reviews.author: Viola E.
reviews.body:
I like it, but my order is for my niece who, loves it and want me to order 
her the beer for her birthday, which is the 31 of this month.
Thank You

Viola English

reviews.author: Kor
reviews.body: Very sweet - this isn't a 'dry' stout. Marshmallow flavor is great - totally Stay-Puft. This plus graham crackers and a Hershey bar and you're in S'Mores territory. Highly recommended. Pours and drinks smooth from the can.

reviews.author: Gary K.
reviews.body: This is my Uncle's favorite beer. It's definitely on the sweeter side but still very solid. I would personally give it a 4.5 out of 5, but if you don't like sweeter stouts I'd avoid it.

name: Garage Hatch Chile IPA
description: This unique American IPA has aged Hatch chile flavor with medium-low heat and is so delicious you'll have to buy another (or two).

reviews.author: Lisa W.
reviews.body: It’s my husband’s favorite and we moved put of the area and can no longer purchase it locally so happy to have found you so we can order it. It’s amazing!

reviews.author: Melinda
reviews.body: I’m not a huge ipa fan but I do like spicy beers. Pretty good. Drinkable

reviews.author: Lindsey
reviews.body: Love beers brewed with peppers or chilies and this was beautifully made. You can tell the chilies are there for sure and they don’t take a backseat at all! It isn’t overwhelming so you could enjoy more than one.

reviews.author: Andrew
reviews.body: Spicy, but it's not going to burn your tongue: the chili adds a nice flavor that compliments and contrasts with the hops. I can count the number of beers I've had like this on one hand, but this one might be the best of them all.

name: Garage Peanut Butter Chocolate Milk Stout
description: This scrumptious stout touts rich, bold peanut butter aromas and a silky chocolate mouthfeel with flavors that will remind you of classic peanut butter cups.  Contains Lactose.

reviews.author: Ryan
reviews.body: Don’t taste too much peanut butter. Taste coffee and choose more. Still a good stout.

reviews.author: Deanie G.
reviews.body:
This beer is light but my wife loves it 
The peanut butter flavor is pronounced and many beers don’t have that great beer

reviews.author: Thomas
reviews.body: This had a good taste but unfortunately milk stouts don't agree with me.

reviews.author: Joss L.
reviews.body: Taste like Reese’s

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.body: Very impressed. Smooth and had a distinct peanut butter aroma and finished with a peanut butter aftertaste.

reviews.author: Kenneth B.
reviews.body:
Superb Wild Ale. Fruity nose with a hint of Brett. Fruity opening, light peach gives way to a well done Brett funk. Dry finish leaves you wanting more. Very easy drinking, more tart than sour. Hazy and cloudy in the glass, some sediment in the bottom. The bottle is corked under the cap. I imagine it could age pretty well. 
 Overall very well done, well worth a purchase.

name: Jester King Ol' Oi! Sour Ale
description: In Britain, what started out as young or “mild” dark ale was once aged in oak barrels to make something that was likely similar to sour brown ales of East Flanders. Using a similar base recipe to Commercial Suicide Dark Mild, Ol’ Oi is Jester King’s tribute to that tradition.

name: Jester King Encendia Sour Ale
description: Farmhouse ale brewed with agave nectar, epazote, and ancho chiles and aged in Scorpion Mezcal barrels from Oaxaca, Mexico! Encendía is a collaboration with longtime friend Kristina Bozic.

name: Knee Deep Simtra Triple IPA

reviews.author: Alex
reviews.body: Poured hazy amber into a full sized thistle glass. Yes libby's makes them, Wish it was fresher, about 3.5 months old. Wonderful from start to finish. Easy hop nose, spicy bite, complex finish. In other words, pretty kick butt triple. :)

reviews.author: Thomas S.
reviews.body: Knee Deep is one of best craft beer brewers. Hoptologist put it on the map and they continue to put out outstanding IPA’s. Simtra is another IPA that is above the rest!

reviews.author: Paul
reviews.body: Packs a punch, but still leaves you wanting more and more and more!

reviews.author: Lindsay
reviews.body: This is one of my go to bombers. I always purchase this one when it is in stock! All the way around it’s a great tasting beer.

reviews.author: Lindsay E.
reviews.body: High IBU but not super hoppy. This one is great. Definitely leaves you with a little buzz!

name: Jackie O's Bourbon Barrel Dark Apparition

reviews.author: Randall
reviews.body: Reminded me a lot of BBA Ten Fidy

name: Holy Mountain The Seer
description: The Seer is a hoppy saision brewed with pilsner malt and wheat, and hopped aggressively with galaxy and ekg. this batch was fermented with one of our house saison cultures and aged in an oak foudre with brett. after spending 4 months in oak, the seer was dry-hopped with galaxy and ekg and conditioned in the bottle with brett.

name: Grimm Cherry Rebus Sour Ale
description: Foeder-fermented mixed fermentation golden sour with tart cherries: Concentrated aromas of dry cherries dominate the nose with very subtle baking spice notes of vanilla and cinnamon stick. The fruitiness is backed by a bright, funky, and rounded acidity that spreads out in the mouth. Topped off by a dry, slightly tannic finish.

name: Gigantic Massive! - Port Barrel-Aged (2019)
description: The 2019 Massive! long boil single-malt Barley Wine was aged in seven different kinds of barrels. In addition to the traditional bourbon barrel aging (Buffalo Trace and Woodford Reserve) we also aged in Scotch, Porter, Mezcal (sold out), Maple, Rye and Cognac.

name: Gigantic Ginormous MK9 Imperial IPA
description: Ginormous MK 9 Imperial IPA is a delightfully hoppy combo of Amarillo and classic Cascades in a well-balanced and drinkable IIPA. 8% ABV

reviews.author: Jus i.
reviews.body:
Damn this is hoppy 

Gigantic is nice beer but pricey. At I percent you only need one. I'd buy it again.

name: Gunwhales California Cobbler Sour Ale
description: Farmhouse Ale with Rye, Peaches and Cinnamon aged in Oak Barrels.

name: Garden Path Fermentation The Prime Barrel Age
description: This is Batch 2 of The Prime Barrel Age, our mature barrel blend. This is a blend of beer from four puncheons and two smaller barrels with an emphasis on subtlety, balance, and nuance. It's a little tart, a little funky, but still really easy to drink.

name: Garden Path Fermentation The Curious Mix Methods
description: A blend of mature, barrel-aged beer and stainless fermented beer inoculated with coolship wort and keg conditioned with honey.

name: Garage Imperial Oatmeal Brown Ale - Barrel Aged
description: This out of the ordinary Imperial Brown Ale is darker in color than a typical brown ale, and it features toasty, nutty and light vanilla notes.

reviews.author: Kevin
reviews.body: And this one meets the grade. Good malty flavor, smooth mouthfeel and you really don't notice the alcohol. It tastes almost more like a stout, but a rather restrained one, without coffee notes. i liked this one a lot.

name: Funk Factory Pruim Sour
description: Pruim is a new Méthode Traditionnelle (MT) beer aged on over 3 lbs/gal of purple plums from Barnard Farms in Door County, WI. They’re a family-owned farm and have been sustainably growing some of our favorite cherries, apricots, peaches, and plums in the area since 1972. We love working with them, and using their fruit in our beer has always led to outstanding results. Last summer they brought down 500 pounds of plums, and we designed a blend of 18-30 month-old spontaneous beer around them. After processing the plums and refermenting them in the beer for two months, the tannic skins and sweet flesh contributed a gorgeous coral color, as well as a crisp, rounded juiciness to the already complex beer.

name: Funk Factory Geuzeria Bière De Coupage Reserve Sour Ale
description: Bière de Coupage was one of our favorite releases last year, and as such, we thought it deserved some special treatment. The 1 and 3-year old spontaneous beer and foeder saison blend was rested for the better part of a year in a freshly dumped Mourvèdre wine barrel from the Paso Robles region in California. Due to extended aging, the barrel’s instinctive rustic nature and red currant flavor are boldy expressed, which elevates a beloved beer to even new heights.

name: Funk Factory Blackberry Meerts Sour
description: Meerts is our take on the style of beer traditionally derived from the second runnings of Lambic. Our modern interpretation begins with Pilsner malt, raw wheat, and Saaz hops, which is brewed using a turbid mash and long boil, and fermented in French oak foeders with our wild yeast. This version was then refermented on blackberries for two months prior to bottle conditioning.

name: Founders CBS Imperial Stout
description: CBS was born when we stumbled upon some bourbon barrels that had previously housed maple syrup. We opted to put the same base beer as KBS, an imperialized version of Breakfast Stout, in the maple barrels and, after one taste, we knew we had something special. Rich maple syrup, roasted coffee and velvety chocolate meld together in what can only be described as a transcendental drinking experience.

reviews.author: Lawrence S.
reviews.body: Delicious. I will definitely buy this again.

reviews.author: JOE M.
reviews.body: It was smooth and a great beer

reviews.author: Jesse
reviews.body: Founders makes some of the best barrel aged beers on the market, and this is the cream of the crop. Like a pancake breakfast in a glass, you get notes of maple, honey, caramel, and cream along with vanilla, milk chocolate, and oak. Really hope they bring this back again!

reviews.author: Andrew P.
reviews.body: CBS is one of the best tasting beers ever. The rich taste with a hint of maple wakes your tastebuds and the ABV is the icing on the cake. Thinking that Founders would stop producing this beer is mind boggling. Get it while you can and cellar it!

reviews.author: Michael H.
reviews.body: Great taste. Right amount of alcohol

name: Founders KBS 2020
description: This beer taught us that patience truly is a virtue. KBS is a big imperial stout brewed with a massive amount of coffee and chocolate and then bourbon barrel-aged to perfection. Incredibly silky and full-bodied with notes of vanilla, cocoa, roasted coffee and charred oak.

name: Funk Factory Apricot Meerts Sour
description: foeder fermented sour beer aged on apricots

name: Firestone Walker Manestave Wild Ale
description: Wild ale with Plums, Raspberries, caviar lime, and Meyer lemon. Collaboration With O'Brien's

name: Firestone Walker 805
description: A light, refreshing blonde ale created for the laid back California lifestyle. Subtle malt sweetness is balanced by a touch of hops creating a versatile beer with a clean finish.

reviews.author: Jennifer B.
reviews.body: Its good for a lighter beer. Not as flavorful as other Firestone Walker beers but still a good beer on a hot summer day.

reviews.author: Donna S.
reviews.body: It is my boyfriend’s birthday tomorrow and I purchased this because it is his favorite. He loves the taste, not too strong and very refreshing.

reviews.author: Joseph C.
reviews.body: Being a Harley nut I discovered this beer from the different west coast riders I follow. I tried it on a business trip to Vegas and fell in love. Being able to get it shipped to NJ was a great thing.

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.body: This is a great, easy drinking Blonde Ale, perfectly suited for a warm sunny day. At about 4.5% ABV, it makes for a good session beer. I will have another!

reviews.author: Michelle D.
reviews.body: Loved this beer and the idea of having it shipped to us on the complete other side of the country.

name: Elysian Space Dust IPA
description: Manic IPA series. The hopping is pure starglow energy, with Chinook to bitter and late and dry additions of Citra and Amarillo. OG 16.8°P/1.068 SG

name: Evil Twin Oh My God, He's A Bozo!
description: Imperial Stout Bozo Beer and barrel aged it in Maple Syrup Bourbon Barrels from BLiS Gourmet for 18 months.

reviews.author: LuAnna H.
reviews.body: Boozey!!! ( I like that! )

name: Deschutes Black Butte Porter
description: This is the beer that started it all. A delicate, creamy mouthfeel contrasts with layered depth revealing distinctive chocolate and coffee notes. Dark and rich, yet easy to drink.

reviews.author: Craig D.
reviews.body: Quite creamy, Advertises notes of chocolate and coffee. Chocolate definitely comes through more, though flavor is not overpowering. Overall a very solid porter. Will definitely stock this stuff for the colder months!

reviews.author: J K.
reviews.body: This beer is awesome. It's rich and creamy with coffee and chocolate overtones but without the bitterness common to porters or IPA's. Too bad it's only available in small quantities. I procure all I can.

reviews.author: Edward
reviews.body: Deschutes makes a solid porter everyone should try. Perfect for the winter nights.

name: Dogfish Head 120 Minute IPA

reviews.author: Tad F.
reviews.body: 120 minute is one of my favorite IPAs. I am glad it available on Craftshack, since it's still hard to find in my state. It is dank, rich, wonderful hop notes, with a warmth at the back end from the high ABV. It truly is unlike any other IPA, and is best enjoyed in small sips. The taste is complex, and more flavors come out as you drink it. Highly recommended.

reviews.author: Jason W.
reviews.body: It is always a treat to have any Dogfish beer and this is no exception. It is not overly boozy but check yourself if not used to this level of ABV.

reviews.author: Jeff
reviews.body:
look: Clear, gorgeous honey-copper. Amber head and messy lacing. This has serious legs.
smell: Incredibly rich floral hoppy malty nose. 
taste: Again, rich and decadent. Bright hops and sweet malts with balls to spare.
overall: Transcendent. This is a beer but it's a unique creation. Kind of a Hop Port. I guess some would criticize ever giving a perfect score. Imo, a beer that is transcendent, it's own thing and I would't want anything changed deserves it. Kudos Sam and team.

reviews.author: justin
reviews.body: This is a high octane beer for real drinkers.....puts hair on your hair....this is not for the timid but damn for 15 percent alcohol it is sweet and smooth

reviews.author: Eddie T.
reviews.body: Always a treat when i get this a couple times of year. Dont be fooled though, drink these slow as the ABV will creep up on you!

name: Deschutes Obsidian Stout
description: A stout as black as the nearby volcanic flow from which it is named. Dive into its dark, robust depths with intense layers of espresso and chocolate. Roasted malt and barley give it a full, toasty finish.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.body: Jet black color with a thick rocky tan head and a full nose of dark chocolate and roast. Taking a sip, the beer is full in body with harsh roasty char, bittersweet dark chocolate, and black coffee. Harsh (but wonderful) roasty bitter finish. I wish the glass would never end!

reviews.author: Edward F.
reviews.body: An excellent made Stout. Smooth and toasty.

reviews.author: William
reviews.body: Great beer.

name: Crooked Stave Progenitor Sour Ale
description: 1. Dry Hopped Golden Sour Ale

name: Crooked Stave Salvador Cybies (Double Barrel Aged In Leopold Bros Maryland Style Rye Whiskey Barrels)
description: Salvador Cybies Maryland Style Rye Whiskey: Belgian Style Dark Sour Ale Double Barrel Aged in Leopold Bros Maryland Style Rye Whiskey Barrels with Colorado Cherries.

name: Chimay Premiere Red
description: First sold in 75 cl (25.4 fl.oz.) bottles, it is noted for its copper color and as the first beer brewed by the monks of Chimay in 1862.Topped with a creamy head, it gives off a light, fruity apricot aroma produced by the fermentation. The taste perceived in the mouth is a balance confirming the fruity nuances noticed in the fragrance.Its taste, which imparts a silky sensation to the tongue, is made refreshing by a light touch of bitterness. To the palate, the taster perceives a pleasant astringency which complements the flavor qualities of this beer very harmoniously.This top-fermented Trappist beer, re fermented in the bottle, is not pasteurized.

name: Chimay Grande Reserve Blue
description: Originally brewed as a Christmas beer in 1948, this dark ale has rich flavors of mulling spices and caramel, with a smooth palate and warming finish.

name: Alpine HFS IPA
description: Mosaic, Citra and Simcoe hops

name: Alpine Nelson IPA

reviews.author: Nichole E.
reviews.body: My co-worker is a big beer collector, specifically IPAs and she was so excited to get this from me. Amazing beer

reviews.author: Dustin H.
reviews.body: I love Nelson hops and this beer did not disappoint.

reviews.author: doug f.
reviews.body:
Been waiting a long time for this highly sought after RyePA to re-emerge. Nelson lived up to it reputation and the BeervAdvocate reviews
 Get some!!!!!!

name: Crooked Stave Nightmare on Brett
description: A demonic dark sour, Nightmare on Brett takes on many facets during its transformation to the sour side. Initially aged in large oak foeders with our mixed culture of wild yeast and bacteria, this beer is then transferred to bourbon and whiskey barrels. The various spirit barrels bring on a new life to this beer as it conditions for months, while obtaining additional bourbon and whiskey characteristics. Dominated by dark fruit aromas and flavors, the underlying cacao notes meld with an acidic tart berry finish. With each batch release being a unique blend of barrels, the multiple variations of Nightmare on Brett released throughout the year prove that with creativity and experimentation, anything is possible.

name: Alpine Duet IPA

reviews.author: Craig M.
reviews.body: It is very good.

name: Alesong Kind of Blue
description: Our light bodied Belgian-style ale was matured on whole local blueberries for a deep purple color and a balanced berry aroma. The oak aging layers in hints of vanilla and mild dry tannin notes. Secondary fermentation adds in a firm acidity and an earthy character that will continue to develop over time.

name: Allagash White Ale

reviews.author: BD
reviews.body:
1 finger, stark-white, and pillowy head - very good retention at 1/4". Pale and soft yellow color (matches the label on the bottle), and opaque. Early spotty lacing and more throughout the drink.
Yeast, soft spice and floral nose. Orange / orange blossom. Faint banana yeast character. Wheat.
Flavor follows the nose, great balance of spice (coriander and the bright lemon notes that come from it), fruit, yeast with a slightly chalky feel and wheat malt.
Medium body, soft mouthfeel. Carbonation level is perfect. Medium length and delicate and dry finish with a touch of persistent bitterness.
Very good.
So refreshing and enjoyable!

reviews.author: Linda D.
reviews.body:
Love Allagash White. Drank it while in Maine few years ago. Wasn't able to find it anywhere .....until now. Like the smooth taste with the touch of fruit and spice.
LJ

reviews.author: Kevin C.
reviews.body: A very nice wheat ale, with Belgian yeast flavors running around in the finish. Noticing that it is 30F outside, and thinking this would be so much better in summer, as a refreshing cool-down from being out in the sun. Seriously, a very good wheat ale.

reviews.author: jule r.
reviews.body: If it's Allagash - it's good to great!!

reviews.author: Jeremiah
reviews.body: Allagash knows how to make a quality brew. This beer is quite tasty.. it may seem to be a simple quality, but damn is it made so well.

name: Alaskan Icy Bay IPA
description: The very intense, complex aromatic character with a refreshing, crisp finish is achieved by dry hopping. The fruity, citrusy aroma is a nice complement with grilled prawns and spicy foods.

reviews.author: Guy W.
reviews.body: My first order. It was amazing!!!!!

reviews.author: Katharine M.
reviews.body: They were happy to try this beer! They loved the it!

reviews.author: Dory A.
reviews.body: All the beers are good. I love all the can designs. Very unique style.

name: AleSmith Barrel-Aged Mexican Speedway Stout (2018)
description: This variation of our Imperial Stout combines a portion of the year-round version combined with a portion that went through a lengthy aging process in freshly used tequila barrels. The blend is then combined with Dominican Republic cocoa nibs and cocoa powder, Madagascar Bourbon vanilla beans, Ceylon cinnamon, and blend of Mexican coffees. The result is a luscious, complex brew with notes of vanilla, oak, cocoa, and caramel.

name: Alaskan Husky IPA
description: This IPA has brilliant clarity and exhibits tropical and stone fruit flavors with aromas of tangerine and papaya.

reviews.author: Thomas K.
reviews.body: Hoppy goodness. A full flavored ale without overdoing the hops.

reviews.author: Terry T.
reviews.body: The very best amber ale!

reviews.author: Ian H.
reviews.body: All time favorite, if someone said “pick a beer to drink the rest of your life,” I would say Alaskan Amber.

reviews.author: Diana D.
reviews.body: Loved it since I first had it in Alaska years ago. Was glad to see I could get it delivered because it is not sold anywhere here in Virginia. Still as good as I remember.

reviews.author: Kelsey
reviews.body: We love this beer! Tried it when we went to Alaska, will definitely order more best website to order from!

reviews.author: James H.
reviews.body: Enjoyed immensely, used to drink this beer when I was stationed in the Northwest, I now live on the East coast and can not purchase locally.

name: Allagash Barrel & Bean
description: Barrel & Bean starts its life as our Tripel—a Belgian-style golden ale. We age that beer in bourbon barrels for just shy of two months, before blending it with cold-brewed coffee from Speckled Ax, a Maine coffee roaster. The sun-dried Ethiopian beans in the coffee are known for their stone fruit and dark berry flavors. The finished beer features rich notes of caramel, bourbon, and coffee.

reviews.author: MIchael A.
reviews.body: It was ok. Not enough barrel aging for me. But smooth easy drinking

reviews.author: BD
reviews.body:
1 finger white head on a gold-orange Tripel...opaque. Good retention down to 1/4" and early lacing.
Initial nose is mild coffee. Wood starts to show about 15 minutes in...toffee, caramel aromas. Bourbon hint late. 
Flavor is coffee (smooth and mild) up front followed by a hint of citrus midway through. Coffee, fruit, spice, and the mildest bourbon towards the end.
Medium body and carbonation with a creamy mouthfeel. Dry finish.
Very good and unique.
I suggest spending about an hour with this one for all the nuances to show out.

reviews.author: Vince Y.
reviews.body: It was good in moments, but not as expected from the description.

name: 3 Fonteinen Oude Kriek

reviews.author: Anthony
reviews.body: All around great solid Kriek. Champaign style head and foam, tart cherry, musk, and earthy flavors.

name: 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze Cuvée Armand & Gaston
description: Blend of young, middle-aged, and old lambics, brewed by 3 Fonteinen. One hundred percent natural, authentic, spontaneous, and a bit stubborn, but always elegant and full of character. The Pure Passion, as Armand and Gaston have always done.

reviews.author: Gregory
reviews.body: This was an exceptional lambic and truly unique. Would highly recommend although is expensive so not an every day beer!

reviews.author: Shane C.
reviews.body: Excellent balance of effervescent funky tartness.

reviews.author: Brendan
reviews.body:
Like lambics you say? Seriously?? If you haven't grabbed this, you really should! 
Highly highly recommended purchase ~~

reviews.author: Jon Q.
reviews.body: Fantastic beer! Super dry and earthy. I wish I bought more!
